Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described - chic and basic”
Reviews.Author: sdb_wm
Reviews.Content: A lovely unpretentious hotel, friendly staff, quiet clean room, simple modern furnishings and the website description is accurate. We had a room on the third floor with canal views and it was worth paying a little more for this. It was exactly what we'd hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, quaint, but more than basic! The perfect accomm for our weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: DanAndLiz L
Reviews.Content: Situated less than 5 minutes walk away from Amsterdam Centraal Train Station, this hotel was perfect my boyfriend and I's short weekend away. Hotel staff on reception were extremely friendly and helpful, offering recommendations for the best coffee houses and restaurants in town. The fact that the reception is open 24/7 is also a plus. Breakfast was downstairs in a little kitchenette, where they offered a help-yourself selection of toast, jams, marmalade and a coffee machine. This was explained on the website and was exactly as expected so nothing to complain of from our end! Some couples brought cheese and ham along with them as well to the breakfast, but toast + jam suited us just fine. The coffee machine was available all day which was great for a quick pick-me-up latte as you're walking past to your room! Our room was the attic room, which was so lovely and surpassed our expectations. A good size, extremely clean and it provided the basics for what we needed for our short weekend away. The shower in the en-suite was my highlight; a huge walk-in shower occupied half the bathroom! I would say the only downside, (and the reason why we are giving it a 4/5 instead of 5*s is the "double" bed, where being typically European they have pushed two beds together, which rolled away from each other quite easily during the night meaning you have to utterly jump ship if you want a cuddle! For me, it was the little touches in the hotel such as the cutesy soap packet message (see picture), the decor of the sofas downstairs and the random shoe buffering machine which added a quirky humour and quaintness to the hotel on Herengracht Street. For me, I thought it more than catered to our needs and surpassed our expectations and was perfect for our weekend away. As for those who reviewed it more negatively I can only imagine they stayed for longer than a couple of days and could understand that the not-so-extensive breakfast would become a little tiring. I would recommend this hotel for couples who are on a budget, want to have great location close to restaurants/coffee shops/canal/train station, and aren't staying longer than a couple of days (ideally).

Reviews.Title: “Goog hotel, walking distance to everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: MelbCHick81
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and as the name says basic hotel, no frills but it's got all you need. We got the XL room and it is massive! A bit of a climb to our room so not for the unfit, only have to go up to the room a couple of times a day anyway. Good location close to the central station, friendly staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the chic?”
Reviews.Author: eded2005
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic place -- and that is all. Close to the central train station and facing a nice canal (but with lots of rooms in the back, with no view, and steep steps up to the 3rd floor). Got a tiny room and the toilet was outside the room, with no heating in cold winter -- even though it said in the reservation that it was a "room with a bathroom with shower". Give me a break. Never again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff, good room”
Reviews.Author: juliehudson1215
Reviews.Content: Our room had not yet been updated to the Chic and Basic style, so I cannot comment on what the better rooms looked like, but our room was clean and completely comfortable and fine -- didn't seem old and grungy at all. The beds are comfy and linens are nice. We also had the bonus of a private outdoor patio with a table and two chairs. The staff are very helpful too. But by far the best part is the location. Very close to the train station, but far enough away that it's not dangerous or touristy. It's on the edge of the Jordaan, which is a lovely neighborhood. So it really felt like we were close enough to the hustle and bustle but on a quieter side street that felt safe and is just beautiful. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, we could go anywhere by foot. Our room had a nice view on the canal and was clean but it was not as design as the pictures on the website (we chose the vintage room, that's why I think). However i really enjoyed my stay,especially the nice staff, the free breakfast (hot beverages and toasts) and the free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Boutique-Attitude+Great Location=Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RegionalRoadie
Reviews.Content: Chic & Basic Amsterdam came recommended from a friend who travels solo frequently (as I do too). He told me about its great location and that he would recommend it to me. I read the reviews and saw commenters that fell into two distinct categories: *Those who felt the product was over promising (perhaps that was the Chic in the title that did that?) *Those who felt the location was superb even if the rooms are quite small. My one night stay in December right before Christmas was very pleasant. The rate was very fair as I suspected occupancy was low. The quick take is that I was very pleased and I would definitely stay there again. For starts the hotel is a very short walk from the Central Station. I would say 8-10 minutes depending on how much luggage one is toting and how bike traffic is encountered. The next observation was the serenity of the Herengracht canal which the hotel faces. The canal and surroundings make for lovely ambience. The lobby visually has the sleek and basic signature of a hotel trying to be a boutique. The furnishings are IKEA-like, basic, but uncluttered. THe check-in was very quick. Luckily, I was traveling light because there are lots of stairs to negotiate to get to the rooms. Be prepared to make a few trips if you're toting lots of luggage as there is no elevator. My room was perfect. It was small but cozy (sorry I can't recall the room number). The room was ideal for someone seeking day sleep after a long flight because there were no windows, only a skylight that had it's own drapery to effective block out the sun. The single bed was comfortable. There was a small desk and "enough" space left over bearing in mind I was a solo traveler and I didn't have that much luggage to start with. The bathroom facilities were great and since I'm a stickler for shower water pressure, it was a relief to see there was plenty of that too. I'm still using the great smelling body wash that is provided under their own Cheap and Basic label. Where can I order more? My comings and goings from the hotel were always met with upbeat staff at the front desk. I walked all over Amsterdam until 0100 and never did I have any safety concerns as Herengracht is clearly a very upscale area and the hotel entrance is well lit. The hotel's location is really a big selling point to me. Everything downtown and as far as Leidesplein are within easy walking distance. The neighborhood felt very quiet and yet very close to the action. My only complaint echoes those of others in that the breakfast offerings are pretty meager. Sure, the continental breakfast is free but I merely gave it a side glance on my way out. The slim offerings of bread, a toaster, and some jam hardly seemed worth the while. The hotel shines in location and it's understated but chic lobby feel. This hotel in my view is then a basic but unpretentious boutique-esque property. The lobby and check-in area is not substantial in size, so if it's a W Hotel abuzz with hipsters and mood lighting you seek, this hotel by design doesn't have those trappings. However, for an active traveler who appreciates a degree of value, quick access to downtown, the train station, and rooms that have character I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible hotel for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Franziska J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the train station led us to this great hotel along the historical Herengracht. Reception staff was always friendly and keen to help. Some may say that the breakfast is too limited, but for myself and for the price I had to pay for my two night stay bread with butter and jam plus a wide selection of different teas and coffees was just right!

Reviews.Title: “Good one for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: catareenas
Reviews.Content: Tiny but clean rooms, good value for money, great location (close to train stn), overlooking a canal.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the chic and basic in a basement room for 3 nights. Overall, I quite liked the hotel. It's very much what the name implies, a stylish place with all your basic needs. We would stay again. Pro's: -Great location just a few minutes walk from central station but not in the thick of the touristy area -Modern style -Lovely coffee bar that was always open for a quick pick me up -Helpful staff -great shower in the bathroom Cons: -the "free continental breakfast" was extremely sparse. Toast and jam. -The upkeep was a bit to be desired in a few areas (dents in walls, computer in lobby wasn't always working etc...) -Room was tight (we were ok, but some would find it too small) -Wifi didn't work in our basement room -The bed was two twins on casters that rolled a bit...not the best for snuggling!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the chic and basic”
Reviews.Author: KentLucy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab position, right on one of the canals and within walking distance to all the main attractions! the hotel is small but it's Amsterdam! most rooms are small- look at the buildings! the view from the room is great which made our stay really pleasurable! Definitely stay here for a really great value stay in a beatiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and cool”
Reviews.Author: lovelifeholiday
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, downstairs has a seating area and free coffee and tea. We stayed in a large vintage room, quite quirky with bats and butterflies painted on the wall. The room had a fantastic view over the canal but was small. However for the rate we paid you cannot complain! Fresh towels every day although the maid tended to come at around 10am and if your having some big nights in amdam like we did, then it's a bit of an unwelcome call!! The room was very homely though with a nice big radiator that you could switch on whenever you like, it felt like we were staying in someone's house which was really lovely. Was a very pleasant stay, friendly staff and good location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Afw1980
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend and what a find indeed, the place was great value for money (we paid â‚¬75 per night) very central, central station 8 mins walk, Anne Frank and flower Market 10min walk, red light district and dam square 6min walk and jordaan 5 min walk! Area very quite but close to all the main attractions, toast and spreads available self serve in the morning all Inc in price, tea and coffee and free Internet available all day and also free wifi codes available from reception! All trips and bike hire can be organised through reception too! Only downside was our room was very small (although the bed was very comfortable!) but if you are anything like us we don't go on city breaks to spend it in a hotel room but just to lay your head for the night! Also very close to a very trendy coffee shop called amnesia which played some great beats and bob Marley tunes but wasn't too touristy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. To get to it turn left out of the hotel and it's by the 2nd bridge on the same side of the road! All in all a great hotel and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff - excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: j24681177
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 night stay- hotels was in ideal position.5 - 10 min walk from everywhere. Room was a bit small and right up in the rafters but it was very clean and modern. Also very quiet. Cannot comment on the breakfast as we failed to get up either morning. Coffee facilities a nice touch though. The staff were the most friendly i have ever encountered. At 100 eur0s a night i was a bit pricey but unless you want to stay in a dormortory with shared facilities you have to pay a little more ... free internet available in lounge also...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple”
Reviews.Author: sam1am
Reviews.Content: The name did describe (mostly) this hotel. Definitely basic; and mostly trying to be chic. We stayed in an 'updated' room, which was small (not much bigger than the bed), but clean and did what it needed to. Found the sayings on soap, shampoo, room keys, etc. very amusing! Walking distance from the Central Station was great; we stayed here on the night prior to leaving (via the airport) and it was fast and easy to walk to the station and take a train to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Stewie M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend of boozy debauchery in Amsterdam. The room was small but Chic and perfectly clean. The rate was equally small. It's in the centre of Amsterdam so food or drink is irrelevant. The staff were sweet (and rather pretty). So we thought they delivered exactly what they claimed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and loud - not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: lela_b_2010
Reviews.Content: This place was at a good location, close to the train station, but that's about the only good thing about it. The hotel is currently under renovation, had we known, we wouldn't have stayed here - they started banging and drilling at 8 am!! Our room was not yet renovated - however, it was horrible looking - very small, and really, really dirty. I understand that eventually it will get renovated, but I did not want to pay 130 euro a night to sleep in a dirty room. It was a complete rip off. The bathroom was insanely small as well - you can't sit on the toilet unless one of your shoulders is hitting the sink. I've travelled to Europe before, and I've seen small rooms before, but give me a break - at that price to have it that small & dirty is just unacceptable. There were cobwebs in our room, obviously they did not care to clean it for the guests. Would never go back to this place, and I hope the rest of you don't wast your money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: SJamesM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I only stayed here one night, but the pictures definitely look better than the reality. Our room was the size of the double bed, and the hallways reminded me of a university residence hall. There was dirt smeared all along the wall going up the stairs, and the overall feel of the hotel was very run down and dirty! The bathroom was fine though, no complaints there. The location was great, situated along a gorgeous canal in the jordaan, which is the best area to stay in amsterdam. Free internet is offered in the lobby. We overpaid for this hotel, and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and basic is what you get”
Reviews.Author: tonyb82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is precisely as it's name suggests, chic and basic. The rooms are clean and there's free coffee and tea (decent coffee) in the lobby area 24 7 . The room we had was on first floor overlooking canal. Wouldn't want to be there if it's really hot as there is no ac but been Amsterdam I wouldn't imagine this been a big problem. My only critique would be the breakfast which was TOO basic...just bread and some jam spreads. I understand they want to be basic and all but for the price we paid, over 100euros, at least offer a croissant or something other than just sliced bread. We got bikes from the hotel which i recommend as it's the best way to explore. Awesome location for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “quirky but perfect for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: noodles70
Reviews.Content: first visit to amsterdam with a friend on a city break,(and weather was in the 20's on our visit which was a huge bonus), and found this super place to stay. its about a 10 minute dander from the train station and main tourist area, but where its situated itself, is quiet and very relaxing, over looking a canal. the area feels very safe to walk about even at night. we had a twin room at the top of the house( 3 flights up the winding stair case) so had a good workout of the old calf muscles over the weekend!! not ideal for anyone with mobility problems, think you might have a problem too if suffering from vertigo, so would be worth actually phoning the hotel when booking a room to get one nearer the ground floor if you cant manage alot of stairs. i would also think that if you have been eating the dear old space cake at the coffee shops, your head would be spinning a bit by the time you would get to the top of the house! the hotel is chic and basic, with white paintwork throughout, which really could do with a freshen up ( well... white paintwork only stays like that for a short time after painting before scuff marks start to appear) so i would call it more shabby chic, but the marks etc did not put me off the overall appeal of the hotel. the twin room we had, was big enough for what it was needed for, looked out the back of the hotel, the beds were really comfortable,sheets all nice and clean the bathroom was compact but had a brilliant shower( i want to replace my home shower for the hotels!), fresh towels, soap and shower gel was a nice wee touch. wee flat screen tv which had english channels( any soap addicts will still be able to watch their fav soaps in the evening!), the staff were very helpful , the communal area past reception was nice and airy, and there was a pc that could be used to access the internet/e-mails, which was free. another corner of the communal area was used in the mornings for breakfast, bread ,butter ,toaster and small selection of jams available( the butter was foul... more like a greasy lard type margarine ( stick to just jam on the toast!) also use of the coffee machine which did filter coffee right through to cafe lattes, also a great selection of teas, and this you could access 24/7. the hotel is also handy as a base for walking around the city. in a nutshell, i would definitely use this hotel again and hope to return to amsterdam again in the future. notes about the city :- very accessable on foot to see everything, the canal trips are pricey and if youre on a budget, save yourself the expence and use your feet instead!, watch out for bicycles, theyre everywhere so watch out when crossing roads etc, the cafe culture is fab, though typical of anywhere in europe, its not cheap 5 euro for a glass of wine, 2.50 euro for wee bottles of coke/water/ juice. i would reccomend getting a bottle and when finished drinking, keep and refill with water from the water dispenser in the hotel as on a hot day and walking around everywhere, you get thirsty. if you like cocktails, go to the house of bols, 11 euro in, learn a bit of the history of the distillery and then finish up in the bar where you get a free cocktail and 2 free shots( you can also buy more cocktails for 5 euro each) this is just down the road a bit (5 mins walk)from the Rijksmuseum ( a nice wee hour looking at vemeer and rembrants amongst other pieces of art) ann franks house is also close enough to walk to and very interesting( whilst in the short queue for it , was interested to overhear a canadian ask another person in the queue'' so this ann frank, is she quite famous?'' anyway well worth the hour or so learning all about this young girl and what her experiences were during WW2. the main square is also nice to walk to, the royal palace is an impressive building and there is a great atmosphere. of course you have all the tacky shops selling souvenirs, sex shops, cheese shops( yummy trying out different cheeses on offer) but there is plenty of clothes shops ( H&M flagship store near the square) and in the posh shopping area you have all the big designer labels if you have the money to blow there! the red light district is worth a walk through in the evening, if only to shake your head and think the girls should consider their career options! if you decide that amsterdam is a place to visit , you wont be disapointed, and if you want a hotel that is close to everything then chic and basic is the one you want.

Reviews.Title: “Does what is say's on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: SuperDuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple December 2010/January 2011 over New Year. We had a room that was a little dated but was cleaned daily with a nice little ensuite. The room we had was very dated compared to the hotel lobby and kitchen area - not sure if it was under going a redcoration or what but everything was always very clean. Downstairs had toast and tea/coffee making facilities but we ate out of the hotel for the majority of our trip. It is in an excellent location 5 minute walk from Central Station, very close to all the attractions of Amsterdam, our room had a fantastic view over the Canal outside.I would recomment this hotel if you are going for a short break to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: E011984
Reviews.Content: It definitely lacks the chic of it's brand mates in Barcelona or Madrid. Quite ordinary design and very limited breakfast. Still probably the best option in Amsterdam thanks to its canal views, friendly staff, and perfect location - close to the train terminal , major attractions, yet unexpectedly quet

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bwh_11
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel during 4 days, and it was perfect. Staff is really kind,they help us in any moment. Breakfast for free and also tea and coffe. Internet too for free. The hotel is only 5 minutes from central station, and it is placed in the best area of Amsterdam, in the city center.Very nice room, so clean and beatifull with canal view. In my opinion, the hotel style is great, it is different, and prices are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: robmh
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located about a 5 minute walk from the Central Station in a quiet neighborhood in Amsterdam. The staff is friendly and the rooms are simple and clean. Most rooms tend to be a little small but are generally a pretty good value. They provide a breakfast which unfortunately is only bread/toast and jelly/jam but there are plaves to eat nearby. They also offer free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NikiCoogeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here for 3 nights, the location was really close to all the shops, coffee shops and mayhem, but far enough out of there for peace and quiet. You could go the other direction from the touristy part (where we found some local markets, sort of on the way to Anne Frank's house) and experience more of the lifestyle of Amsterdam. Wondering through the little streets and canals was just awesome. The room was basic and had a fabulous view over the canal. The stairs were really narrow and steep so if you may need a bit of muscle to get upstairs if you have heavy bags, we had backpacks and it didn't bother us. Staff were helpful, no problems there. The only negative I have to say is there was no safe in the room and the shower didn't have a screen or curtain so the whole bathroom floor got wet everywhere so that was a bit weird. I liked the selection of pillows available too, the only problem was the staff at the time couldn't find the one I wanted. Apart from that everything was great! p.s Vondel park is a bit of a walk away which we did but you can catch a tram there, its the best park, its like their beach, so chilled out and absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not chic and a little less then basic”
Reviews.Author: beverley_atkinson
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is an amazing city and well worth a visit. We stayed at the Chic and Basic for four nights. The location was perfect, on a canal and close to everything. But I was shocked at actually how basic the room was. First of all the bed took up the majority of the room. There was barely enough space to walk around the bed, the shower had no edge around it so the water spilled on the bathroom floor, there was a portable fan in the closet (air conditioning),breakfast was bread and jam and coffee, water was in what looked like a cooler but was actually coming from a pipe in the wall. If you just want a place to crash and you are young enough not to let the lack of ameniies bother you the location is perfect but if |I have the privledge of visiting this amazing city again I will pay the extra euros for better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed second visit”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July 2011. I loved it last year when I stayed up in the top room with a canal view last time so decided to come back, but this time with my low budget, I stayed at a 'traditional' (not redecorated in 'Chic and Basic' style) room. A big mistake. Very dark and tiny, a carpet was very dirty, a tiny closet filled with junks (such as a big ironing board and a fan), a broken safe box. It was just depressing. Yes, 60 euro difference and completely different rooms. Staffs are still the same - young, pleasant, helpful. Free coffee all day is nice. Still, a big disappointment. Good I booked at another hotel (Hotel Sebastians) in the same neighborhood for the last two days in Amsterdam. Although I didn't particularly like their decor, for 5 euro less, I go so much more there. Chic and Basic .... if you are going to stay here, stay at the top Canal view room. Other rooms...maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic... and a little chic”
Reviews.Author: Veronica80
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam is not cheap. This hotel has a reasonable price and has an excellent location near the central station but still in a very nice area, Jordaan. The rooms (we chose a L) are of a good size and reasonably clean. The "continental breakfast" was toast and jam, with coffee or tea, which was kind of a let down. But, at this price and location, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Name of hotel should emphasize basic”
Reviews.Author: MM_World_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) The location of this hotel is superb. It's less than a 10 min walk from Central Station, yet sits on a quiet canal street away from the hustle and bustle. My wife and I stayed 3 nights and felt safe in the neighborhood. 2) This was one of the best values we could find in town as everything in Amsterdam is ridiculously expensive. 3) They have bicycle rentals on site with prices that are in-line with other bike rental places. Very convenient as we rented them first thing in the morning at the front desk and returned them at the end of the day. Bikes are a must in this city, if not for the convenience, then for the experience! Cons: 1) As for the rooms, they are extremely basic, with typically small European sized room and bathroom. There were stains on the walls that weren't very pleasant to look at, but whatever, it didn't get us down. 2) We were there in May, the air-conditioner in the room wasn't on, not even for a fan. This made it a litle hard to sleep as there was no air circulation. We were on the first floor and did not feel comfortable leaving the window wide-open. 3) No breakfast So overall, I would recommend this to anyone traveling on a budget with low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: lanie
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect, close to central train station, awesome view of canal, quiet street, most affordable, very clean, nicest staff @ front desk, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Aficiondo
Reviews.Content: It was ok. Clean and location wise very good.But not chic, my room was furnished in the early ninties and then someone painted supposedly funny stuff on the dark wooden furniture. Basic, yes. Chic, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lacey082
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on a canal in Amsterdam so our room had a great view (although our other friends' rooms did not have any views). From the hotel you can walk or bike to most tourist destinations like Anne Frank House, Dam Square, Red Light District. The hotel itself is clean and yes, chic and basic. It's quite modern yet simple, but it has everything you need including free WIFI. Breakfast consists of just toast and jams and coffee. There is free drinking water too. There were a few different options for types of rooms when we booked. We booked the medium room and it was all we needed. The reception were extremely helpful with where to eat and go out. But we found people in Amsterdam were all helpful and friendly! Amsterdam is a beautiful city and staying here was perfect as it was modern, clean, had a great location and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, funky decor”
Reviews.Author: cmorta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Chic and Basic with my fiance for 2 nights during the last leg of our summer Eurotrip. After staying at a series of quaint and demur hotels, Chic and Basic was extremely refreshing. Upon entering, we were immediately in the "Amsterdam" frame of mind. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the decor was upbeat and modern. The location was superb... right on one of the prettiest canals, and mere blocks from most attractions and areas of interest. If you're focusing your trip around the Heineken tour or Museum district, this may a *bit* too distant for walking... but doable if you're up for it! Finally, the kitchen downstairs was a WONDERFUL bonus! The simple breakfast was so convenient, and the 24 hour coffee/espresso machine ALONE makes my stay at Chic and Basic totally worth while. One word of warning: the facility does not have AC, so this may not be the bets choice in the dead of summer. Otherwise, I would not hesitate to recommend Chic and Basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price”
Reviews.Author: da33Melbourne
Reviews.Content: You can walk from this hotel to everywhere in amsterdam. The room was very nice and staff very friendly. It was hard work getting the suitcase up the narrow stairs, but that's only 1 minute of pain for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bplanet
Reviews.Content: I went with my girlfriend for a couple of days and we really enjoyed a wonderful stay. We had a room with big windows overlooking the canals(imagine the romantic iluminated canals during the night!), and the city center was just 5 minutes by walking. The Front Desk staff were totally helpful and friendly. We always received a big smile after any little question we had. For sure, we will choose this hotel again for our next stay in Amsterdam!.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: CY2
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for a discount price. We arrived at 7am straight from the airport and the staff were very accommodating, we helped ourselves to the breakfast bar while they checked us in (very) early so we could get a power nap before exploring the city. The room was small and at the top of a very steep set of stairs but it had everything we needed. We loved everything about Amsterdam, including the Chic & Basic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, basic ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Marisa_L99
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay somewhere in Amsterdam that was inexpensive, especially safe and very close to the train station as I was traveling by myself. I booked this room after reading reviews on trip advisor and was for the most part satisfied with my stay. The hotel was a 5 min walk from the train station, walking distance to many attractions, yet tucked away on a quiet street. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and referred to me by my name when I returned at the end of the day. I did have two slight complaints about my stay. The first was that my room was not renovated like those pictured on their website. I had a note in my room apologizing for not having the renovated room and it also stated in the note that a buffet breakfast was currently not being served. My rate stated that a continental breakfast was included, yet the only thing that was provided was toast and coffee. I have been to many hotels in Europe and knew not to expect an American style hot buffet, yet I would not call toast a continental breakfast. Both those complaints being said I would still use this hotel for brief stays such as this was as it's clean, in a great location, affordable, and has friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: eccentrick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this just last week. Great place to stay, free breakfast and internet. Just have to wait for everyone to log off so you can get on. Even books to read if you don't want to sightsee in a number of languages. Coffee and tea available all the time as well - free! Really close to everything as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb”
Reviews.Author: DebNJohn
Reviews.Content: The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff more then makes up for the dingy room we had. We were in room 211, small, as per normal. No view - but next door to smoking area ( which was convenient for us). Room cleaned everyday, no quibbles about fresh towels, in room coffee/tea replenished every day. Lobby is lovely with free internet access, a kitchen for use with hot coffee on tap all day. The coffee is FRESH, ground, and just lovely. You pay 2/3 euros per cup everywhere else so we made full use of this. Basic breakfast, toast, butter and jam FREE -which helped us save money. Location is superb, five minutes from train station on a lovely canal street. Never bothered by noise from traffic or party goers. Close to everywhere. Will stay there again ( though not room 211) and have looked into their branches in other cities. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no-nonsense room, charming and not American by any means.”
Reviews.Author: n8andm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chic & Basic in 2008 in the large suite off to the side of the main hotel. It looked like we lived there, it has a a separate, private entrance with no hotel markings. The bed was okay, the closet was dark, the furnishings were Ikea but the room was large. The bath was large and Mediterranean themed, kind of old with dated tile and fixtures. Not a glamorous room, but great for maybe backpacking? We were also given the option of staying on the top floor for them same price, it had a better view but you had many flights of narrow stairs to climb. I do not recommend this place for your average over-weight person who travels with a lot of luggage. It's charming and they have an instant espresso machine that we really enjoyed. The convenience and location are great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, modern and great location.”
Reviews.Author: prudence22
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is a 7 minute walk from the station and 2 minutes from the start of all the restaurants, bars and coffee shops. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who very kindly upgraded us to a canal room! Only reason being, they were fully booked the day we arrived and said they were alot quieter the following day so we could have a better room, which was lovely so we stayed in the room we booked for the first night and upgraded the following nights. All the staff were very friendly and the hotel was absolutley spotless, and you don't get cleaners knocking on your door in the morning! They just simply wait til you have left. The area was quiet yet very close to everything and rooms were lovely and clean with a nice personalised letter, waiting on the bed welcoming you to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JAPL01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chic and Basic over Valentine's weekend. We had booked a Medium Vintage Room several months earlier,. When we arrived, we were told that we were being 'upgraded' for our second night, but not the first night, since the room wasn't available. When we were taken to our room, it was soooo tiny, you could hardly move around the double bed. We then told the receptionist that we would like to take up their offer of an upgrade for the second night and we questioned whether the room we had been shown was a 'Medium Vintage' room, we were assured it was. Anyway, we do think that we were in a lesser room than the one we booked for the first night and that the 'upgrade' was really just moving us to the room we should have been in, but who knows. On a plus note, the hotel is in an excellent location. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, even when I emailed a couple of questions before we arrived. The rooms (both of them) were spotlessly clean and the beds were really comfortable. My husband and I would def. stay at the Chic and Basic again and would recommend it to friends, but ask for a decent sized room!

Reviews.Title: “Travel guide”
Reviews.Author: drix666
Reviews.Content: The first time to visit Amsterdam was not easy for us. Everything was strange but the staffs became our guide. They was very friendly and helpful, gave us a map and introduced about some attractions in Amsterdam. The room was large and clean in quiet environment. I recomment this hotel for all to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quircky and fun”
Reviews.Author: MonicaW_8
Reviews.Content: Very nice place in Central Amsterdam, quiet, really cute and quircky decor and rooms are very comfortable. great mattrass and good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Basic - what more could you ask for”
Reviews.Author: PJL1981
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam for the first time with my girlfriend in order to celebrate her birthday. Identified the hotel on TripAdvisor prior to booking. Hotel is in an excellent location on the canal, nestled between the traditional houses/apartments. Only a short 10 minute walk from central station, 5 minutes from the main drag (trams, shops, etc), less than 15 minutes to Anne Frank's House, and less than 10 minutes to the Red Light district. Rooms were quite basic: bed, flatscreen tv, bathroom/wetroom, hairdryer, hanging rail for clothes, but decorated simply & tastefully. The views of the canals from our room were very postcard picturesque. No set breakfast to speak of but toast & condiments were available in the morning, whilst hot/cold drinks were available around the clock in the kitchen. The little contact I had with the staff was pleasant and their non uniform policy gave the hotel a very relaxed feel. My girlfriend & I both enjoyed our stay in the hotel & would stay again. The only negative are the perilous staircases. If you want a room with a view you're going to have to take on the narrow stairs (traditional in this sort of building), which seem to get steeper the higher you go as there is no lift available.

Reviews.Title: “Cool small hotel, smart choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SSEFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times when visiting Amsterdam for work, as it was recommended by colleagues. Easy walk from Central Station and handy for my work in the Jordaan area, which itself is very cool with great cafes and bars. This is a very smart choice, with a boutigue feel but without the high price. Steep stairs to my room, no view but modern, classy and comfortable. Good amenities e.g. big shampoo/gel bottles to take away! Healthy self-serve breakfast (in a lounge area) is extra but (good) coffee is free. No 'service' to speak of, one or two stern and efficient staff at front desk, but you are not paying for service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place (but pack light - killer steps)”
Reviews.Author: Dannex
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for 3days/2 nights and I stayed at this hotel for a couple of reasons. a) Recommendations from fellow TA members b) Price c) Location It was along Herengracht, one of the many canals in Amsterdam. Coming out from the Central Station, head west straight into the beginning of Herengracth and you will get there in less than 10 mins walk (provided you don't lose your way). The hotel looks good even from the outside, and they have very friendly English speaking staff manning the counter most of the time I was there. It was situated right beside the canal and it is very pretty and calming, unlike the hotels in the middle of the town where traffic becomes a concern. Because I arrived earlier and the rooms weren't ready yet, they provided left baggage service FOC. Rooms were pretty good, my only gripe was there was no heater near the balcony door. It was pretty damn cold at night (during winter). Beds were clean, room service was provided too. Overall it was a good stay, reasonably priced and I would love to give a well deserved praise to the hotel management for keeping up the standard.

Reviews.Title: “chic and more than basic”
Reviews.Author: Pantheramed
Reviews.Content: We booked a room to mounths earlier paying in advance, thanks to this we obtained a good discount. It has a great position, near the central station. The room was clean and conformed to the description of the website. The toilette was not very big, but confortable use (Per gli italiani l'unica cosa che mancava era il bidet ). The staff has been kind and polite and we loved the coffe machine everyone can use it 24/7...

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.........”
Reviews.Author: sarah197832
Reviews.Content: The Chic and Basic is the 6th hotel I have stayed in within Amsterdam and I would probably rate location and cleanliness as the best I have stayed at. It is a ten Minute walk from Damrak and also in a nice quiet area and it felt very safe. The room was on the small side but Amsterdam is notorious for it's small rooms thats what you get, but it was very clean.The bathroom was ample for two of us,the bed was ok bit hard for my liking but each has their own idea of comfort so...The staff were friendly on the reception the lady doing breakfast shouldv'e been a bit more friendly in my opinion,a good morning would be nice but she was very busy doing the washing up ect.Which takes me on to the one thing I think lets this hotel down hugely.....The "breakfast". It was jam and bread-not toast-bread.This to me is not breakfast not even continental.Fair enough there was a toaster there but to wait 10-15 mins for it to turn slighlty toasted is not my idea of fun!I believe a good breakfast is needed to start your day off with all the sightseeing /cofeeshops wandering around it is imperative-it just let it down.If you have booked a room and breakfast is extra do not bother that is my advise.The coffee machine is a fab idea and comes in very handy!! All in all I really liked the Chic and Basic and would recommend it minus Brekkie!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mighty_zarquan
Reviews.Content: Loved the look and style of the hotel, nice touches everywhere, a lot of thought has gone into it. Rooms were compact but clean and stylish. Staff helpful. Free internet PC, coffee machine and shoe shiner. Breakfast is toast and a croissant if you are lucky. Quiet location but only 5 minutes walk from the station and nightlife. All in all we thought it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Chic and Basic - Small but beautifully packaged.”
Reviews.Author: missvee79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in September 2009. Travelled with a firend (two girls) and stayed here for three nights. Hotel is clean, modern, bright and fresh. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Gave us a free breakfast (not sure if they meant to), looked after our bags as we arrived very early and left late. Very small room and shower room, but was enough for our needs. A rail with hangers, rather than a wardrobe and literally a bed and somewhere to put your book/keys/phone and nothing else, so suited to travellers who travel light/hand luggage only. But you are in Amsterdam! You aren't going to be in your hotel room other than to wash/sleep. Free coffee machine was a godsend. Would recommend to those who dont take everything but the kitchen sink, who dont' mind basic, but still want to feel like a grown up and not slum it. Large window looked out onto the street/canal so careful unless you are comfortable flashing Jo Public.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, "chic & basic" truly sums it up!”
Reviews.Author: mcg1881
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother for 2 nights in October. The hotel is located very close to the train station which was convenient, especially because we arrived late in the evening. It's situated on a charming side street, right on the canals, away from the crazy tourist sections - yet it's close enough to walk to most sites should you choose. The hotel name sums it up - truly chic and basic. The lobby is very modern, bright. The people at the desk were very friendly and helpful - which was a relief as we were coming from Paris, where that is not always the case. 24 hour free coffee & tea from a very fancy machine that makes cappuccino, espresso, regular coffee. The complimentary breakfast does the trick - meats, cheese, pastries, breads. Also, yogurt & granola, hard boiled eggs. The rooms are tiny - Very Important: be sure to ask for one that has been remodeled. Not all have gone through the process yet. Ours hadn't at the time, which is why I had to give a low rating under the "rooms category". It's a tough pill to swallow knowing you're probably paying the same nightly rate as the people next to you, and they are sleeping in a remodeled room. Oh, and free wireless for our entire stay! After paying upwards of 5 euros for an hour of wireless at other hotels in Europe, this was such a treat! All in all, the hotel was a delight and great for the money.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hostel not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: robinsonm008
Reviews.Content: As a relatively frequent visitor to Amsterdam, I know that hotels are expensive for what they are. This hotel was very disappointing. The medium room that I booked was horrible. Tiny, dingy, the toilet had a pipe attached to which was a shower head and that was the ensuite. The sink was in the bedroom as there was no roon for it in the toilet room. Moved to a vintage room, no window at all, broken safe, horrible brown carpet, dingy and small, all for 110 euros. Don't be seduced by the breakfast. Either sliced brown bread or white bread, which you could toast and that's it. Machine coffee that tasted cheap. Juice on Friday and then none. No extras at all, not even an egg! Location is nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VovaPutin
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but the service was excellent, great value. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Liked free internet and coffee machine. Parking on the street in front of the hotel was 45 euro for 24h, but there are cheaper options available.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you pay for XL room”
Reviews.Author: katrios
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a XL room for three days. The room was in the first floor of the next building of the hotel and it was really nice because of the wiews of the canal. The room was huge and the bathroom too. The room needs an extra lamp. The hotel offers caffe and bread every morning. Nice staff. The hotel is more basic than chic, but the place it's perfect for visiting Amsterdam. Tip: There is a great restaurant called: De Keuken van 1870 at: Spuistraat 4. It's very close to the hotel. They serve traditional food for a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: pedsnp
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a convenient location. Fits it's name althought I think it is a step up from basic. Friendly helpful staff, and the coffee pot is always on.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here over the UK Bank Holiday weekend, what a gem, perfectly located only 5min walk from the station (by far the easiest way to travel into the city) and in a beautiful spot. Everything was very accessible and well within walking distance. The rooms small but perfectly formed, although the room my daughter had at the back didnt have a window that you could see out of and was rather warm (but she's all freezing anyway, so loved it). We had a room over looking the canal and what a beautiful view. All the rooms were very clean and well presented. Breakfast was only toast but free and a nice extra that we were not expecting and free tea and coffee at anytime. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful, would definately stay here again, and shall try the one in Barcelona, our next mini break!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel: Avioid!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyfloyd33
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the WORST hotel room I've stayeed in! Dirty, cramped, noisy and felt un-safe. I have to say the staff are very friendly, but that does not compensate for the appalling room. The tiny room's walls were covered in black marks (when someone had tried to swing a cat maybe?), a tiny dest and wardrobe all-in-one, and windonws looking up onto the street - yes, UP onto the street as room is below street level. The old windows do not seem secure, and without a room safe I took all valuables with me when I left the hotel. The bathroom's light switch was broken and had to be pushed about a bit before the light came in. The bathroom walls were full of random drilled holes for no apparent reason. What's the point in having 4 types of pillow on offer when the basics aren't in place! Was booked for a business trip for 2 nights and arrived at 10pm tired and ready for bed. Awful night's sleep, so left the next morning and stayed the next night at a hotel for the same price 5 minutes away which was a far better experience! Do youself a favour - go elsewhere when visiting Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zhosze
Reviews.Content: It is as the name suggested, it is basic and pretty cheap for being so central and right by the canal. The location could not be more perfect, it is on one of the most picturesque part of the city (Joordan) and it's only a 5 minute walk to the train station. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but clean and more than adequate. Alas breakfast was only toast, but it was free and the endless supply of very good coffee was a plus. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique hotel, very good location!”
Reviews.Author: michaelvdm
Reviews.Content: The room looked nice and clean. Trendy hotel with good breakfast and super location in the town center.

Reviews.Title: “'Chic' and 'Basic'”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel name says it all. PRO: great location (in one of the most beautiful areas in Amsterdam), 'chic' furnishing/decor (even though it's IKEA-ish) fast free internet in a lobby (Mac) CON: a little overpriced, breakfast (I hate that machine made coffee, please at least give us freshly brewed coffee...), bathroom walls peeling, amenities not refilled (had to use one tiny soap for three days)

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: tenvsrini
Reviews.Content: Chic&Basic is a cosy little hotel about 10 minutes' walk form the central station. We arrived early for check in. Our room was not available, so we were offered the option of checking in to a smaller room and moving to our chosen room the next day. We took it, and except for the first day, were happy with the spacious room. Breakfast was included with the reservation, but there wasn't much variety on offer - we had to make do with just bread. There coffee machine in the lobby was a welcome amenity. There is no restaurant or room service, so we had to go out for all our meals. The staff at the reception were friendly and eager to help, but did not always have the information we were looking for. The problem with the hotel is the staircase. There are no lifts - and with a room on the third floor, we had to carry our heavy bags up the extremely narrow staircase. So narrow, in fact, that we feared for our safety while walking up with our hands full. We talked to other guests and they felt the same way too. We booked through the hotel's website at an advance purchase rate, but left with the impression that there might have been better options closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “what a find !!!!”
Reviews.Author: trixieLosGatos
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed this hotel. the location was great and we had the most wonderful room - the top floor with a marvellous view. the help could not have been more helpful ! they carried our luggage up five flights of stairs with a smile...... they recommended local restaurants..... and they suggested a picnic and supplied the directions to the park and the glasses/knives/napkins we would need. we heartily recommend this hotel and would stay again with great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says - "Chic and Basic"”
Reviews.Author: RunningDogYankee
Reviews.Content: I love a hotel that lives up to its name, that is well placed, good value for money, and doesn't pretend to be anything more than what it says. I've been coming to Amsterdam for years and finding that right balance between price, location, and accomodation can be difficult. I highly recommend this hotel because it meets the minimum 2 - 3 star criteria in a 4 star location. It's located right on the Herengracht canal, away from the tourist carnaval and noise, but right around the corner to convenient restaurants and other attractions near the center. Best of all the room I had faced onto the canal (although in the summer time it can get a bit hot with the sun shining into it). it's cozy and situated right in a quiet neighborhood. The only down side is the 3:00 pm check in time, which is a pain for jet lagged travellers arriving in the morning. Still, I give it a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate”
Reviews.Author: amber12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Tuesday and Wednesday, June 1-2, 2010. We payed a little extra for a room with a canal view. It was very small, but very clean. Nice view and extremely convenient to Central Station and anywhere you would like to walk. I would definately stay here again, but be prepared for the small size.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel room in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: SonaG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights earlier this month. It is an easy walk (about 5-7 minutes) from the Central station.....located in jordan....not right in the middle of the tourist ares at the same time not very far from them.The staff is welcoming and ready to answer all questions patiently. Based on the reviews here, I had booked a medium modern room and was happy with it. It was comfortable even with its very basic furniture. The bathroom had only a shower (wish it had a bath) but was spotlessly clean and the shower provided lovely hot water with good force. The toilet was separate, across the room. The bed was big and comfortable since I had booked a medium room in spite of being a solo traveller....but I found it too soft for my liking. Breakfast only included sliced bread, butter and jam......one was welcome to use the automatic coffee machine any time during the day. Free use of internet on the computer in the lobby was a big advantage. It was cold and rained during most of my stay and I was able to borrow an umbrella from the hotel. This was my second trip to the city.....highlights this time included visits to the keukenhof, delft, utrecht and the hague. For the first 2 days I assumed the piled up garbage was a result of the ever increasing tourists and other people in the city....later realised that there was a strike on and unfortunately that tainted the impression a visitor may have of the city. Overall, I had a good trip......would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & basic, rather than chic”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for its style/cost/location ratio and found it OK but hardly stylish or chic. Staff are very friendly and helpful and I appreciated being able to check in on arrival (around 11 am) rather than waiting until the 3pm advertised check-in (which is too late - hotels are pushing this time further and further out). Room and bathroom were spotless, bathroom in fact seemed newish, but the layout of the room was most peculiar - no windows, only a massive skylight that took up half the bedroom ceiling and which allowed at least 3 sets of windows from other sections of the hotel to look down into my room. A curtain could be pulled across the middle of the room, dividing the bed area from the table, tiny wardrobe and TV area, and that allowed the only privacy possible so one had to duck behind the curtain to change clothing in the narrow strip of floorspace by the bed. This curtain was also the only way to darken the room for sleeping. To cross into the bathroom at the opposite side one had to be fully clothed... a most peculiar set-up and the cute painted monkeys on the walls didn't make up for the inconvenience of this, nor justify the hotel's claim to be chic! I was tempted to ask for a room change but I was only there 3 days to catch up with friends so spent little time in the room and frankly I have never found hotels in Amsterdam to be up to much. I had booked a double room despite travelling alone & am very glad I did as the one I got was small enough (there would never have been enough wardrobe space for 2 people to hang even one change of clothes each) and I hate to think what a single would have been like. The bed was firm enough for a decent sleep but the foam pillows and foam-type duvet filling were not very pleasant but seemed clean. Some reviewers from a while back have mentioned breakfast but a note handed into my room after check-in advised that there is no longer a buffet breakfast available - all one gets is supermarket sliced bread, a toaster, butter pats and 3 types of jam. The DIY coffee machine makes excellent coffee however. The location is the best part - far enough away from the really squalid parts of Amsterdam around Dam Square yet easy enough to walk to most attractions. Would I stay there again? No. But then I rather hope I won't have to travel too often to Amsterdam in the future. This time it was suffering from a garbage strike and the piles in the streets were getting higher and higher and beginning to smell - just as well the weather was cool. But even without this problem this city is, unfortunately, getting grubbier and sadder as the years go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideNev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chic & Basic in early May. This is a fantastic hotel. Their attitude is second to none. Breakfast is free - There is a kitchen & you make your own coffee & toast with choice of 3 jams. Internet access is free. Rooms are modern & clean. The hotel is very central, you can walk to the city centre & railway station. Nothing was too much trouble - I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I PUFFY HEART THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: Puffy Heart is such a cute way to describe this hotel because it is in such an amazing location and really stand true to the style of Amsterdam CHIC & BASIC. The hotel is literally located 5 minutes walk from Central Station right next to the Herengracht Canal. Amsterdam can look spread out on the map, but from this hotel everywhere is walkable. Around the corner of the hotel starts off with a row of coffeeshops that takes you to an alley of shops, delis, and more coffeeshops. Dam Square is walkable from Herengracht and from there you an walk to RLD, then end it in Damrack. With the hotel being close to Central Station, not only can you take a train to any parts of Europe, but shuttles to other parts of Holland, and canal tour boats to the rest of Amsterdam. I would hightly reccomend getting the Medium Modern Hotel Room, although small, it was enough space for 2 people and 2 large luggages, good use of small furnishing, and comfortable/cozy stay in Amsterdam. Expedia has the best price for this hotel. Our room was in the top part of the hotel, the attic, since there was an extra set of stairs to get to the bedroom. The reception was great with a welcoming letter directed to the guest including a brown paper bag with soap, shampoo, and two types of water (sparkling and regular). The lobby is really comfortable and love the kitchen with the free coffee, espresso, cappucinno, tea, and water. The staff were so friendly, just like the rest of the people of Amsterdam. Now the negative, no elevator. Prior to my departure, this is what I reccomended when I filled out the review at check-out. If you look at the buildings of Amsterdam they are very narrow. Yes, the stairs were very narrow and after going up 3 floors to find another set, you gasp for more air. Hopefully one day they can build an elevator for guest to use to get to their floor. Chic & Basic was a second choice from the Bellevue and was very glad this hotel was the winning choice. There is no doubt I would come back here again next time I go to Amsterdam based on the location, value, friendly staff, comfortable stay, and cutesy of it all. P.S. FREE WiFi! BON VOYAGE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware the Vintage rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steph V
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its proximity to the train station and the website's description of the rooms as "...guest rooms are brand new, modern and at the same time comfortable". I can assure you that our room was nowhere near new (see pics). The walls were beyond overdue for a paint job...plain pewter or tan walls would have been an improvement over the Smurfs, clowns, and circus flags that we had to look at. Despite a small, cramped room with a poor set up, the bed was comfortable and the shower had good pressure. The public areas of the hotel are clean and modern and the breakfast was good. Beware of steps - our room was up one flight of very narrow, treacherous steps. We needed a shower and a nap by the time we got our luggage hauled up! I would stay here again but only in a Modern room (which cost more).

Reviews.Title: “Charming, location, friendly, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaEd
Reviews.Content: Located a few hundred meters from the train station. Turn right out of the station before crossing the canal and walk across the canal in front of the Ibis Hotel, then under the major street, all on a ped/bike path. Avoid traffic! Five to ten minutes! Nice old hotel with small rooms and steep winding stairs and great canal views. Our top floor room, 131, was quiet, and the beds were great.. Free internet station downstairs. Nice friendly staff. especially Jenny and Palerma. Breakfast kind of steep and skimpy. We were referred to Pancakes! at 38 Berenstraat. About 10 small blocks, walking past teh Anne Frank house. Great pancakes! Didn't open unti l10am, like most places.??

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Amsterdam begins here”
Reviews.Author: smolinskisr
Reviews.Content: The chic and basic hotel in Amsterdam was a great find. If you're going to Amsterdam, this is really the best place to stay, it's right in the center but on a quiet canal. Price was great, and we rcommend taking the breakfast. The rooms are very well kept and have just the right combination of decorations. Everything is clean and tidy, and the staff is excellent. Especially the manager, he was very helpful with just about any request we had.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and eco-friendly hotel just in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: martiago
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely little hotel right on the canal, in a quiet and elegant street. It's a five minute walk to Central Station and another 15 minutes to most any other spot in the city. We stayed at fourth floor, in a very nice room, total white. Every morning we had the old canal houses just in front of us and it had such great charm. The staff was nice and smiling, good breakfast in the morning and free internet all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good value”
Reviews.Author: trinzeon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first time December 09 and very happy. Room is modern/chic and small. free coffee and internet access. Great location on Herrengracht. 10 minute walk from Centraal. Very friendly and accomodating staff. good size bathroom. No lifts to upstairs rooms. Will.make this my regular stay in A'dam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sarahpo77
Reviews.Content: I only stayed there for a night, and the staff was extremely nice (they even upgraded my room, which was gorgeous), the bed was wicked comfortable, and the location is great if you're looking to take in the sites of the real Amsterdam. It's a bit of a walk (and what a scenic walk it is) to Dam Square, coffee shops, etc. So if you're looking to get a real taste of beautiful Amsterdam, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel...I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Flatlander3
Reviews.Content: After scouring Trip Advisor for hotels in Amsterdam my friend and I settled on this one. It was a little more than we wanted to pay but it had a private bathroom (which is hard to come by in Amsterdam apparently!). By private I mean in the room but also with a door. We noticed MANY hotels in Amsterdam have the bathroom in the room but either no door or a glass door! The location could not have been better. A 5 min walk from the main train station and in a cozy, quiet neighborhood away from the tourists (Jordan). Great local boutiques, restaurants, cafes and bars all within walking distance. The room was small but clean and we had a beautiful view over the canal. Staff was cheerful and helpful and even helped us with our bags up the steep flight of stairs (steep stairs appear to be unavoidable in Amsterdam if you stay in one of these canal front hotels). Overall I was really happy with our choice and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly chic design, but needs some cleaning”
Reviews.Author: celloflo
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we were lucky enough to get one of the coolest rooms at this hotel, which was essentially in the attic of a canal house. It was intimate with the pitched ceiling and canal view, but chic with the white plastic rocking chairs and halogen lights. It was by far one of the coolest rooms we have stayed in at a hotel, but there was quite a bit lacking in cleanliness. The white modern furniture could have used some cleaning, and the tables generally looked worn. Given the unusual configuration of this particular room, the toilet and shower were in windowless enclosures, where there was a air vent. The vent in the toilet area allowed small (harmless) moths to fly in which was somewhat off-putting. I counted up to 6 moths in there at a single time, and there were always a few hanging out on the walls. On to the shower... The shower vent clearly wasn't doing a very good job because there was mildew on the ceiling. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and loved our room, despite having to ignore the bathroom and shower issues. I think the situation is different for every room though. There is 1 computer with internet, and unlimited use of their fancy espresso drink maker. I loved being able to bring a small pot of tea up to my room every night.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel in a very cool location!”
Reviews.Author: Simone17
Reviews.Content: We stay in a canal room room, very romantic! Modern, stylish and very good value for money. Is not for you if you don't like climbing stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: wolverine2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near the train station but in a beautiful street in the Jordaan neighborhood. The amenities are more than you would expect at this price point - free internet, wi-fi throughout the hotel, friendly service, and clean and comfortable rooms with great showers! We will definitely stay here again the next time we come to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Room with canal view”
Reviews.Author: gronros
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Chic & Basic Amsterdam several times during the last couple of years. Most of the rooms are great but once they put me in a windowless cramped room on the ground floor (try to avoid that one). If you decide to spend a bit more money on the room you get a great view over the canal. The rooms are very minimalist with just the bed, a stool and some hanger for your clothes so don't expect luxury. Interior color throughout the hotel is white which makes everything look very clean. Some nice trendy details make it all work very well. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie058
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right by the canal and although describes itself as basic provides all that is needed for a comfortable base whilst staying in Amsterdam. The room was small but very clean with all the usual facilities such as a hair dryer, iron ect. The decorations were great, querky and very well done. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room but also free tea and coffee and a water machine in the main area. The breakfast was excellent value for money and provided a better breakfast than I have had in some hotels recently which have a much higher star rating. All the staff were very friendly and really helpful. I would definitely go back there if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: kismet33
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 10 days in June. Recommended by a colleague of mine who stayed there with her family. Truly enjoyed our stay, we had the large modern room, which was very clean and spacious. Like the name of the hotel, it is chic and basic. Very good breakfast in the mornings, and free internet access. The staff was great, friendly and helpful! Very convenient location. Short walk from the train station. Short walk to restaurants and shops. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to all my family and friends. Loved Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “I will ALWAYS Come Back to This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadpole1995
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a medium "basic" room, but it was anything but. The room was a nice size considering it was in Europe. I had a full bathtub, sink, desk, nice bed and AWESOME canal view (see photos). It's a hop, skip, and a jump from Amsterdam Centraal Station (I walked, rolling a full suitcase), and is within walking distance of several great bars, restaurants, and the Anne Frank House. The clientele is young but not too young, hip but not too hip. So really anyone will fit in, especially since the price is right. The staff were friendly and helpful and non-pretentious. I personally caused a blackout on my floor and the guy from the front desk didn't bat an eye when called up to help me (and everyone else) out, even though it was 2 am. They even set up a projector in the lounge so we could watch the Michael Jackson memorial on CNN.com. Free cappuccino machine (this really helped me out during a personal crisis) Free internet computer Free wi-fi A lot more than you'd get at most hotels. I later stayed at the Renniassance and it paled in comparisson. Based on some of the reviews, it seems to be a hit or a miss with the type of room you get. But all else makes up for it, and no one else I ran into in seemed to have issues with their room. Everything else about this place will certainly keep me coming back for future trips...it's part of the reason I fell in love with Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Our "home base" in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WItraveler333
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Chic and Basic on both ends of our European trip. While all the comments about small rooms and steep stairs are accurate (over time we've stayed in 4 different rooms on different flours), we have found this hotel very much to our liking. The location is great - quiet neighborhood overlooking a canal and only a few blocks from the train station. We have had very positive interactions with the staff. They have let us check in early, kept our bags in a secure location after checkout and until we were ready to actually leave Amsterdam, and allowed me to "hang out" in their lobby when I had an injured foot and couldn't join my husband walking around the city. The breakfast is quite good compared to many other hotels and the free internet in the lobby is appreciated. Before we found Chic and Basic we had stayed at several other hotels near the train station. We feel much more comfortable here - it's more like a "neighborhood hotel" than a "train station" hotel. When we know we are flying in and out of Amsterdam, one of the first things we do is make our reservation here.

Reviews.Title: “You better like who you are traveling with!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler09
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. That is where it ends though. We checked in at 7pm at night and stood outside in the rain because the front door was locked. After half a dozen buzzes someone came to let us in. We were quickly taken to our "room" which was outside of the main building and literally outside with no covering. We were let into our little cell, which was no bigger than 7 by 7 feet! The bathroom door couldn't open properly because it hit the bed. The bathroom was fine and clean for the most part. We were also able to hear what appeared to be a very private conversation between the people in the room next to us. We were also told that breakfast was served in the morning, which turned out to be quite good. However, be warned, it appears to be a buffet breakfast, which is offered by most European hotels. However upon checkout we were told that we had to pay for it. We had no problem with that, but they probably should have mentioned it! We will not go back and suggest that you don't bother either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - the name says it all !!!!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireNic
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of May. We were welcomed to the hotel by the receptionist who then escorted us up to our room. The room was spacious, the room had 2 single beds, spare fold up bed, a small balcony, window, cupboard/wardrobe, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, tv, welcome pack (bottled water, soap, shower gel, hotel info). The room was larger than expected and even had a small balcony, it was very small but still a great bonus. It would be great when the weather's a bit warmer. The bathroom was extremely clean, walk in shower, large sink and toilet. Lots of towels, changed when needed. The hotel has a computer in the reception / lounge area with free internet access, there's also free coffee and water, there's a secure luggage storage area which alson has safes which are free to use, staff keep this area locked so it's secure. Staff were very friendly and even offered umbrellas when it was raining. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the Centraal Station, really nice location. Overall a great hotel and I would stay there if I ever return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dohadiverdiva
Reviews.Content: Chic & Basic was a lovely laid back little hotel. Fantastic location by the canals, friendly staff. Rooms weren't great but fine for a few days. No room service but you can help yourself to coffee, tea or chocolate from the kitchen any time of day or night. Would recommend it to people visiting Amsterdam for a few days. Not wheelchair accessible and not good for elderly people or small children. However I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Area Nice Hotel Chic & Basic”
Reviews.Author: k1w1brad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife. Lovely hotel in a nice area. Easy 5/10 minutes walk from Centraal Station. Easy to find. Great view from rooms on the river. Stairs are a little steep. Note that if they haven't mentioned that breakfast is included do not assume. But for â‚¬7.50 I couldn't argue with the Cold Cut Buffet with all the usual bread, cheeses, Juices etc. Only a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Red Light District and close to Tram Stops. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Location is good for some nice restaurants and bars around the Jordaan Area. To get a feel of what the area is like see the following links: http://www.jordaaninfo.com/ http://www.amsterdam.info/jordaan/ The room is cosy but the bathroom is more of a 2 star rating at best. No shower curtain so water pretty much goes all over the bathroom. Other than that the room itself is fine and comfortable with a 3 to 3.5 star rating. We had room 321 which is the one pictured on their website. I have attached photo's from the room to give you and idea. Apologies for putting the pics of the bathroom up but would rather you all see what it is like prior to getting there. Service was great. Free internet access. We checked in online and they were happy to print out our boarding passes free which was a nice touch as some places I have stayed at charge it to your room or even charge you at the business centre. I gave a 3 for the Room due to the bathroom. The room itself nice. All in all I would be more than happy to stay ere again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: Lollapot
Reviews.Content: The Good...Check in staff member was very friendly, location excellent and the reception and communal areas very nicely decorated. Bed comfortable and room clean. The Bad...Room had a tiny, cell-like single window that was also filthy dirty, allowing very little natural light in. Showering was difficult because the shower partition was broken and half missing, allowing the bathroom to become soaked. Bathroom a bit mildewy. If you're over 5'9'' you won't be able to stand in the bath to shower. The ugly.. Late arriving guests were allowed to make a great deal of noise until 1am. When staff were politely approached to assist, they were downright rude and unhelpful. The staff member that checked us out on the morning of the 4th of April was particularly unhelpful, rude, unfriendly and really needs some training in how to deal with customers. She expressed no regret or apology for the problems we encountered. We were offered a discount but I would have been happy with a polite apology and friendly service! Perhaps we were just unlucky - there are some great aspects to this hotel and the breakfast buffet was lovely but there is no substitute for basic, polite service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen31
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its very good price and stylish all-white rooms. We spent 3 nights here in February 2009 and were highly satisfied with the service: staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast (7,50 â‚¬) was very good, fresh and abundant.
