At any time of the day and night, you can go to the lobby for a free cup of tea/coffee/water and there's also free internet connection. Our Room was well-sized, with a window overlooking a "hanging garden" and a cozy balcony on the back; bathroom, although without window, was spotless clean. Another plus was the location: at a walking distance from city centre and station but on a very quiet and romantic canal. Would come back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not entirely chic and basic”
Reviews.Author: chocks76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chic & Basic from Good Friday to Easter Sunday 2009. We'd booked based on various reviews but also due to what we saw on the hotel website. The rooms are sold as modern and comfortable. The fact is that not all of the rooms are like this. We had booked a medium room via easytobook.com When we arrived and checked in, we were taken to a first floor room. For those who have problems climbing stairs, please note that the stairs were extremely steep. The room didn't represent what the photos show on any of the websites (travel agents or the hotel site.) The hotel's own website makes no reference to the 1970's decorated rooms with murals of bunting and the Smurfs (!) on the walls. The room was dark, with brown carpets and it looked like a child had been drawing on the walls. We therefore disputed the booking and what we'd been promised and were given the response of "sorry we're full, and you didn't request a Chic & Basic room." We did book Chic&Basic - that's why we were standing in the hotel and also why they had a record of our booking. After much debate and negotiation we were given a small modern room on the ground floor. This was accessed via a door leading to an outside corridor with puddles on the floor. It had a very small window and no natural light. It was extremely small and the bathroom (shower and toilet) was tiny. Despite this, it was very clean, had a flat screen tv and a welcome pack (bottled water, shower gel and soap.) There was noise from an extractor fan at all times which could be annoying for light sleepers. Breakfast is served until 10.30am and has an ok selection of breads, cheeses, meats and fruit. Tea, coffee and water are available all day and for free. The majority of the staff were very helpful and friendly. They allowed us to check in early and store our bags once we'd checked out. The location of the hotel is superb. It's quiet whilst only being minutes from Centraal Station. If you get a decent room with a canal view, then it would be good value for money. I'd advise that you check with them directly before you book that the modern rooms are available, and that you request and receive confirmation of exactly it is you want.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LSETerp
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I went to Amsterdam for a few days, and since this hotel was about the same price as a hostel we stayed there. It's in a great location a short walk from Central Station, and on a very quiet street. We stayed in one of their medium modern rooms, which had a giant canvas photograph as the headboard/light that had different colored lights behind it (they also have "vintage rooms" that are just like any other hotel.) The size of the room was comfortable for two people, and we had plenty of space to move around. The best part about this place was the feeling of hospitality. There was always someone at the reception desk, and at any time of the day or night you could come to the lobby for a glass of water or free cup of tea or coffee from the machine that made lattes, espresso, and pretty much any other kind of coffee you could want. There is also a computer with internet access that you are free to use, and a comfortable lounge area to hang out. The staff is friendly and attentive, and made us feel welcome. One thing I will point out is there is no elevator and the stairs are steep, so anyone with mobility problems would have difficulties. Otherwise a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull breakfest”
Reviews.Author: SII_And_Andreia
Reviews.Content: I love stay in this hotel, the staff were grait. The breakfest was perfect, lot of delicious cheese and all we need !!! aple pai, chocolat kakes, yumm plus plus.I have been two time already in Amsterdan cause I was invited for back with a group of friends, and we stay in diferent hotell and both were grait, but the diference betwen them was the location, Chic & Basic is clouser of train station and a lot of things, we just need walk feew min to get what we need, like restaurants, live music, night clubs etc. I could stay again if I back in Amsterdan. Amsterdan centrum definitely is not a place to come with kids, then I recomend to adult only. Room: Good bad, but the room were cold for me, and quite small...But was enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: wimbledon04
Reviews.Content: 2nd time I stayed on a business trip. Love the location and canal side atmosphere. Staff are very friendly, efficient and laid back, rooms quite small but very clean and comfortable and the best automated latte I have come across. Sets you up nicely for the day.

Reviews.Title: “great trip shame bout the messy hotel service!”
Reviews.Author: airgurl
Reviews.Content: i booked this trip as a surprise for my boyfriends 21st birthday. chic and basic took my fancy as the hotel to stay in as it was a good proce and in a very good location for the station and center etc, however when we first arrived we were told that the room i had requested on booking was no longer avalible as they has just found a wasp nest in it. me and my boyfriend didnt mind this as we fiqured well it cant be helped its not the hotels fault. the room we got placed in was down a outside passage way with no outside window, it was a shockinly small room for the amount i had payed, then next day as we were leaving the hotel to go out we were stopped and told we had to move rooms as the room we were in was booked for someone else for that night. we were told we would not have a room untill 3pm that day. when we got back we had a second room which was a lovely room with a canal view (which i had requested before) however it had two single beds. so we settleed into our new nice room however the room i requested origianlly was just next door, and there certianly was not a wasp nest in there as there was a coulpe staying in that room. yet again when we left the follwoing moring we were told we had to move rooms again. so back to the small room downstairs. and then moved again for our fianl night. so overall we didnt have a hotel room from 10-3 every day. we moved a total of 4 times in 5 days the only offer we got of compensation was breakfast and we were lied to about the room i had requested and told was availble 3 mounths prior to our visit. its a shame to have such hassel on a hoilday. the hotel was nice all be it if your not messed around so much. we will not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved this modern yet cozy place!”
Reviews.Author: nagisa_chan
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently in this hotel with my husband for a couple of days and it was a very good experience. We enjoyed a lot the modern style and I specially liked that I could go to the lobby at any time and get myself a cup of coffee or tea for free! The lobby was a nice place to hang out or internet. In case you don't have your own laptop there is a computer in the lobby for the guest's use. Our room was very pleasant with nice furniture and the bathroom was very clean. Breakfast was every morning and a great variety of fruit! The staff was friendly and extremely accommodating. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gopherstateguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our stay directly with the hotel and let them know that we'd only have two nights to stay in Amsterdam at the tail end of our honeymoon and they were extremely cooperative. They upgraded us to one of their "best" suites and presented us with a free bottle of champagne as well upon arrival. The previous reviews about the stairs are spot-on because they are very steep and lots of them! One other minor issue we had was the angles in the room we stayed in (top floor, probably used to be the attic?) and how many times we could have knocked ourselves out if we didn't duck at the correct time. What it came down to for us, was this was our kind of place because it felt very original and matched the neighborhood scene that we were looking for. I wouldn't recommend this to everyone, especially older folks or conservative individuals. The style is modern and clean, but not necessarily deluxe or comfortable. We loved the staff - especially one of the late-night attendees, who helped us when we stumbled back to the hotel after too many amstel lights and prepared us the most delicious microwave thai peanut noodle dish and ham and cheese sandwich with a free half bottle of wine (that we probably didn't need, but appreciated). He was super nice and glad to be helping us out, which my wife thought was the sweetest thing. Overall, we couldn't have been happier and we're extremely glad we picked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Freezin in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: baldy60
Reviews.Content: We spent four very cold but lovely days in amsterdam. What a beautiful city and a wonderful way to spend the new year. I had read several good reviews on chic and basic i was not disappointed very bright cheery reception area with free coffee machine which was perfect for cold days. Our room was only one on ground floor which meant we didnt have to climb all those steep stairs we had no view though but we didnt mind, the room was small but spotlessly clean beds changed every day, bathroom spotless as well, i think this is one of cleanest places we have ever stayed. The only thing i would say against it is breakfast is rather pricey for what you get, a cooked breakfast is same price in the town. Beautiful quiet location only few minutes walk from central station and very close to dam square.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: hotelobsessive
Reviews.Content: stayed one night having booked over the phone with the hotel. The booking went smoothly. The hotel was as it says in the name, and done very well. It is in a traditional canal house. We had a canel view room and the bathroom was excellent. Breakfast was good and there was a computer with internet access. Staff were helpful and polite. Location is excellent 5 to 10 minute walk from the train station and at the top of the nine alleys area. Beware though there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended by my dentist.....”
Reviews.Author: jajalondon
Reviews.Content: .... but then he is from Amsterdam! He also recommended the area - Jordaan - in general: still part of "Old Amsterdam" and great for just schmoozing around. The hotel is wonderfully located: nearby is a street with bakeries, delis, "coffee" shops,and restaurants; you can walk from the station:it's 0-6km. If you do take a taxi, beware of the drivers who claim not to know where the hotel is: the street number is 13-19. Public transport is a five minute walk away. I had a spacious room (Room 401) with its own front door, so I could pretend to be a real Amsterdammer. It hasn't been given the "chic and basic" treatment yet, but was cheap and cheerful - light, spotless and with a huge window overlooking the canal.Comfortable beds. Breakfast was fine and excellent cappucinos, lattes etc. ( and I do mean coffees) are available 24/7 in the dining area. Staff are terrific: young, mostly Dutch, energetic, helpful, relaxed and genuinely welcoming. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as the name says”
Reviews.Author: robcheetham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Great location; less than 10 mins from the station and max 15 mins to Dam Sq (and thats at a real leisurely pace). Located in a quiet street just far enough away from the tourist track to have shops and restaurants residents would use. But close enough that you can be in the middle of town in minutes. Hotel overall is very clean; it has a white, modern minimalist interior. Rooms aren't large but big enough for a double bed and 2 people not to fall over each other. Each has a slightly different theme (mine was Sports; with rackets, balls, etc painted in corners). Nothing dramatic but makes the hotel a memorable part of break unlike the bland chains. Incredibly friendly staff; couldn't do enough to help. Take their recommendations as to local restaurants. Suggested a fantastic Thai restaurant just around the corner for us. Breakfast is well worth the extra charge. Only thing to highlight is that the stairs are all quite steep. Nothing ridiculous but might be a concern for parents with small children, etc. As for me will definitely be staying at the Chic & Basic when I go back to Amsterdam in the New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: DanPL
Reviews.Content: Well located, trendy and at a reasonable price. Not as nice as the â€œchic and basicâ€� in Barcelona, but it still stands up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, perfect base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dr_abacus
Reviews.Content: my wife and i spent 3 nights at the Chic and Basic and we enjoyed it very much. The hotel is in a good location (no dodgy stuff next door) and is a short walk to almost everything in Amsterdam that you would want to see (and some of the things you might not want to see too :-). The breakfast is excellent, and they will do you laundry for just 10 Euro! All you have to do it drop it off at reception and you get it back in the evening. It was also handy to have access to the internet via the free PC in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Light? and Chic?”
Reviews.Author: Makena07
Reviews.Content: Chic and Basic, as its namesake, is chic and basic. Located close to the train station, this is a great place to stay if you enjoy boutique hotels. We had canal side rooms, which had large windows opening to fresh air and great views. Welcomed with a personal note and welcome pack, the chic white rooms were clean and a good size (although basic- ie., no closet, sitting area). Our room was on the third floor (after two treacherous stair ways-the stairs are unduly steep, short-runs with high-rises, and twist! upwards). It was very difficult to get our luggage up the stairs, and we would only recommend this hotel if you travel light, and are young and able (older folks would have trouble with the steep stairs). The bathrooms are large, but the showers are not separated from the rest of the bathroom (everything get wet when you shower - the toilet, sink, towels and floor, no matter how careful!). The breakfast is solid value, and the staff are really helpful - with luggage storage and arranging bike rentals from the hotel directly). This is a true "boutique" hotel - great if you enjoy a little different room layout, and enjoy the "chic and basic". If you like the little extras in a luxury or business hotel, this may not appeal to you at all. We had a problem with moquitoes coming into through the windows, and the citronella plug-in didnt do much.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: NS007
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here we decided to book in for 3nights. The hotel was excellent, about 5-10min walk from the main train station and a similar distance to Dam Square. In a quiet street overlooking a beautiful canal. Our room was in the attic which was a bit of a pain as there are no elevators and quite a few narrow tight stairs. Some would have trouble negotiating these stairs and would no doubt be upset about it, but you take the good with the bad when travelling in europe. The room was quite spacious with a large double bed, large shower and toilet... both of which were clean. We also had a mini lounge area that consisted of 2 hard plastic funky chairs and an lcd monitor with free cable... lots of channels included, including the adult channel which was good for a laugh. The staff were excellent! very helpful and spoke excellent english. Breakfast was your standard euro breaky with meats cheese breads and cereals. The free wifi was also a nice touch for those travelling with iPhones or laptops. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the chic n basic and would no doubt go back in the future

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, small, Amsterdam style”
Reviews.Author: subtarget
Reviews.Content: Although the landmark red lip sofa 's missing from the front, we managed to find it after getting off the street cars. It was stacked in the back, as it turned out. As promised it was very recently renovated; it was refreshing to step inside the property. Staff were very friendly and showed us to our room in no time. Although there was a bit of struggle carrying the heavy bags up flights of stairs. We booked the large room with canal view. It was not the one on top floor, but still had a good view of the canal and streets. The room was clean and tidy. We didn't bother turning on the sensational colorful lights; just sat down and watched Tv. Though small, the room was well equiped. For our package, breakfast was included. There was bread, cereal, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, fruit. All were fresh and excellent. Online access was limited during our stay, because the main computers broke down, we had to use one at the cafe with a cable connecting to the front reception. There was only one computer available for all the customers of the hotel; I had to resort to uploading the photos to facebook at night as it took a few minutes. Other than that, I had no complaints. Hopefully it will be fixed by the time you read this. I would like to thank the staff for their kind help during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Budget-Tight travellers”
Reviews.Author: M_Pranolo
Reviews.Content: As I used to stay in hotels in Asian countries, I would consider that this hotel has a very small room. But, I think this is quite common in europe. Chic-n-Basic Good: - Clean - FREE and fast Wireless internet access - Nice and very cute soaps and shampoos with all the writings on them. I would think that this hotel is properly managed and thought of. We had a welcome package with 3 bottles of mineral water, 1 soap and 1 shampoo. It also comes with a welcome letter stating about the 'house rule' with the internet access code. - FREE WATER!! yes, it might be redicilous, but, hey...get all you want before you go away with the bike - FREE COFFEE all day long...nice cofee machine (not the cheap one). Check out my pictures - Location...Location..Location. It's true that it's very close from the train station. Euro 10 only to get from station to the hotel and vice versa. It's walkable distance from the hotel. However, beware that your luggage's wheel might go bad since the pathway is very uneven. I would rather take a Euro10 taxy to avoid my wheels being spoiled.It only takes 3 minutes by bike to the Daam and Royal palace (also where the madam tussaude is). - Warm and Family feeling in the hotel. Nice people serving you will answer all your questions and needs (thanks for scotch tape Cynthia.....thanks for the trip advise Ginny) - Whole day bike rental is only Euro 10. Bad: - Very small room - We actually needed to 'support' the big window with a couple of wooden brick in order to make it open. - NO AC (who needs one when it's winter anyway) - Seperate toilet and bathroom. - Steep stairs - We need to ask the reception to open our door manually (this happens to many people staying there..not only us) since they claim that they are fixing the lock system. hmm..it's OK..but it's a bit troublesome to keep asking the reception everytime we wanted to go into the room. We had a false fire alarm when we stayed there (it was around 2am) and everybody ran out of the building. However, the management claims that it was somebody taking a shower and trigger the alarm. We had quite a nice experience there overall. Thank you for the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room, good breakfast, lovely neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AZflier
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Chic and Basic. Easy walk from the train station with our rolling bags. Lovely residential neighborhood right on a canal. We had a great room - large and airy, big windows, very nice bathroom with a door, comfortable bed, flat screen TV. Yes, there were steep stairs, but the staff offered to help with the bags. Breakfast was included in the price and was very good - cheeses and meats, breads, yogurt. We did a lot of walking and found the location to be very convenient. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: InTwoPlaces
Reviews.Content: We always stays in Amsterdam on our way back to US. This hotel is one of the best hotel we have found in this price-class. (We paid Eur 135 without breakfast.) The location is great and the walk from the train-station is a short 5-10 minutes walk. The surroundings is nice and it's easy to walk to bar's restaurants and coffee-shops. The receptionist was very friendly and the room was basic, but clean and quiet. (We stayed on the 2nd floor). The only draw-back is that the stairs is very narrow and steep, it's very difficult to bring a large suite-case up the stairs.(That's the case in a lot of hotels in Netherlands) We didn't have breakfast, it didn't look any special to us, but we enjoyed the free coffee 24/7. Now we now where to stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: TravelcrazyEngland
Reviews.Content: It is exactly what it says it is Chic - painted white and very minimalist. Modern reception lounge Basic - nothing more than you need. Some rooms apparently don't have bathrooms. Our room did have a bathroom but no door (not overly ideal!) The key thing about this hotel is it's location, it is so central. It is just a stones throw from the train station, you can easily wheel your suitcase there if you know where you are going. It is very close to a nice shopping and cafe area and some fantastic restaurants are nearby. We went to Christophe's (highly recommend it) it is the best meal we have had to date. Breakfast is basic, but more than adequate, fresh coffee seems to be available all day via the machine, as is water. Internet is also available in the same area. This hotel has very clever use of space. The rooms up the top are lovely, but beware, as with all buildings in Amsterdam, very steep stairs!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Josalia
Reviews.Content: WOW! This is an amazing hotel in every way: Picture this: You walk from Central Station to the hotel within 10 minutes which is ideally situated along the canal Herengracht. As soon as you enter the hotel everything is made easy for you: a quick check in and the friendly staff shows you around in their lovely hotel! They booked us fabulous restaurants and gave us very usefull recommendations for shows, bars and shopping. You feel very well appriciated in this hotel and the chic&basic staff knows really the best places in town! We stayed for 4 days and we never got bored: First day we rented the bikes from the hotel. On the last day we even made a tour by the chic&basic boat along the canal!! AMAZING it is! We can certainly recommend this hotel to everybody! I would like to thank all the chic&basic staff for the wonderfull time we have had! J&R

Reviews.Title: “Non Smoking, Not Completely True”
Reviews.Author: AlexRobin
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive hotel we stayed in our Netherlands and Belgium trip but then again most of the hotels in amsterdam were very expensive on those dates. We paid 140 euros per night without breakfast and I really wasnt that happy about the place. No refrigerator in the bedroom, bedroom was small, walls were too thin, you can hear everything, above, beside and around you and the worse thing is that I smelled smoking in the other room. When I asked the front desk he said that they have smoke alarms and it would sound if someone smoked in their rooms. We stayed in room 312 and our french neighbors were huffing and puffing through the wee hours of the morning. We hate smokers and that really pissed us big time. As a warning, if you have kids, dont leave them with the remote because there is a porn channel. That might be good for adults :) The room is modern with contemporary hip design. It reminds me of the paramount hotel in NY with its all white simplistic clean line look. Now for the good, Jessica who helped us on our arrival was fabulous, she provides great service and gave a wonderful restaurant recommendation, MUDERS which means mother. This place is not your fancy place but your local comfort food place, oh so yummy. You need reservations to get in and you need to be careful when you look for this place because there are no big signs. we walked past this place 5x, can you believe that? They have free internet connection in the lobby. If they truly get strict with the smoking and if the rates is less than 100 euros, I will recommend this place and even come back

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just completed our 5 week honeymoon trip to Western Europe...I boooked the majority of our hotels with information from Trip advisor... We stayed at Hotel Chic & Basic for 2 nites in April...This hotel was ideally situated on the Herengracht canal, 5-10 minute walk from the train station. The centre of Amsterdam is not very big, and everything was within walking distance of this hotel. We booked this hotel directly for a rate of 140 Euros a nite...(The most expensive on our trip)...The hotel is quite nice, I'm not sure why it's only listed as a 2 star (maybe because it doesn't have an elevator???)...The are several steep stairs at awkward angles throughout the hotel, which is standard for Amsterdam... Our room was a spacious 2 story room with some widowmaker stairs leading to a bathroom...(Be careful if you've had a few Heineken's...hehehehe) Our room did not come with a view of any sort...There was a little window up by the ceiling... There was a 24 hr cappuccino/espresso machine and internet available in the lobby...Breakfast is served in the lobby for an additional 7.50 Euro...The staff was wonderful and helpful... Don't get me wrong this is a nice place to stay and we enjoyed our time in Amsterdam...However, looking back, I'm not sure this place offered the best bang for our buck...

Reviews.Title: “Staff were very very good”
Reviews.Author: Iainlonuk
Reviews.Content: On entering the Hotel, The staff were so so helpful and friendly,The breakfast was ok in the morning, I found the hotel very expensive for what you get, The Rooms were spotless, How ever we had a ground floor room and you could hear everyone having breakfast and talking in the morning, So try and get a room away from the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Merllinn
Reviews.Content: It was great. Although a 2-star hotel, everythink was great. My partner and I had a mini-suite on the top floor and we were amazed how cosy it was. The bed was confortable and the most important thing is that every corner of the room was very clean. Perfect location (5 minutes walk from the station) and great staff. The price seemed a bit high for a 2-star hotel but we didn't regret it at all. Next time I will be in Amsterdam I will surely book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Abby12345
Reviews.Content: Was a little dissapointed with the hotel, Staff were very pleasant and it was in a excellent location however the room was very small although the bedding was clean and the shower also there was a lot of marks on the walls that let this room down ( In nee of a paint i think) also you are lead to believe that the breakfast is free which isnt the case i think they need to change the wording on the rooms welcome note. Also room was nothing like picture of room shown on internet with nice pic behind bed . we had a pic of a glass and a newspaper on our wall ???? Also net curtains could do with a good clean and the view from our window was a dead plant in a plant pot

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: LJar
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a comfortable room with a spectacular canal view in Amsterdam's Jordan neighborhood, and I found one at Chic & Basic. A quick 7-minute walk from Central Station, the hotel sits near the corner of two canals and within reach of several cafes, shops and tourist attractions. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Their breakfast is one of the best we've encountered in Amsterdam (both in options and value). An epresso machine in the main lobby is available 24-hours per day for guests, offering free tea, coffee, espresso, latte, cappuccino, etc. A basic kettle with coffee and tea supplies is also provided in each room. Free internet access and room service are also a plus. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the towels soft. Navigating the narrow and steep stairs will be difficult for those guests lugging large bags. However, the view gained from the top floors is truly wonderful (and the rooms are far more quiet in comparison to those near street level). If you are looking for 4-star accommodation at a 2-star price, Chic & Basic is the place for you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: LondonLupe
Reviews.Content: Its like a hidden treasure at the Canal Herengracht!: BEAUTIFUL! Never found any other hotel in this city which has such a perfect location, helpfull and warm staff and all that for a good price! Its a mix of design, surprising details in an truely unique Amsterdam house, I just LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “chic and small”
Reviews.Author: clivebear
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed for a weekend my room was a small single-even the xl rooms are small,not worth the money and nowhere does it say you pay for breakfast!! staff great except breakfast staff who never smiled once not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “great location - beautiful and modern”
Reviews.Author: mmhbcn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Jordaan, beautiful district with very cozy restaurants. The hotel has modern looks, great breakfast, and the staff are nice and friendly. I stayed in room 342, which is in the third floor, and has two twin beds. The room was OK, but I do have to say that each bed was extremely small!!!! 68 cm wide (which is very small) I actually asked the staff if this was normal, and they said that in Amsterdam hotels it is normal. Apart from this, I would recommend the hotel, but I would make sure, before making the reservation that they book you a room with normal sized beds. Oh, also, the room rate doesn't include breakfast (which was 7 euros, more or less)

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: SandrineParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at Cheap and Basic and I recommend it without any kind of doubts. It's just excellent. The staff was extremely friendly. Breafkast was really good and the location is great. The room was clean, completely new and modern. You don't believe that 's just a 2 stars hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, will be back again”
Reviews.Author: bagel75
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Amsterdam staying at Chic & Basic with family group. I knew from talking with staff before we arrived that we'd be looked after and we were. It was a special surprise trip for our mother and they looked after her so well giving her the best room in the hotel overlooking the canal. Our rooms were less Chic and more Basic then hers, but perfect for our short stay. Location was perfect, just short walk from central station, cafes and main attractions. Staff booked fabulous restaurant for us and arranged taxi's etc, and couldn't have been more helpful. Breakfast was surprisingly nice and better than most continental B+B offerings. Canâ€™t wait to go back for longer next time and will be staying in Chic & Basic again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but not too Basic”
Reviews.Author: Gutterheart
Reviews.Content: What a fab little hotel! About 5 - 10 mins walk from Centraal station /RLD/ all the noise and action, yet it's sooo quiet and peaceful. Staff absolutely superb - meet and greet with a coffee (much appreciated as it was snowing when we arrived!); excellent english and a fund of useful info. The rooms are small but perfectly designed. Bathroom is a wetroom with separate wc. The rooms on their website are the ones you actually get (not some super upgraded version like on some websites) with the lightbox headboard and everything. Everything is ultra ,modern and well designed, and the proprietors are rightly proud of the place. One really nice touch is the availability of fresh coffee/tea/hot choc at any hour in the lobby lounge area - another thing that adds to the very civilized feel of the place. There's free net access in the lobby as well if you feel the need to browse with your coffee. Can't praise this lovely little hotel enough - more that excellent value for money - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer52
Reviews.Content: very good value for money. great location, great service, great room, great breakfast wish there was one of these hotels in every city

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Modern Feel”
Reviews.Author: EuropeTraveller2007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week long trip in Europe. We booked a triple for 3 nights (Nov 20-22). The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the Centraal Station. It took us longer because we missed a canal. But it is very, very walkable with wheeled luggage. I was impressed when we walked through the front door. The lobby and lounge is very cool. It has a modern minimal look, but is very comfortable. The staff was very nice. They had us sit down, got us coffee and or tea, while they did the check-in proceedure. They showed us the room. This might be the only small issue I had with the hotel. They did not have an elevator, but I think this is very common in Amsterdam. To get to the room we had to go up a very steep winding staircase. It was not really that bad. My 75 yr old father with knee problems was able to do it, but it was a little bit of a challenge, and if you travel with anyone that has limited ability here will be an issue. The room was very cool. Again minimal and modern but clean and looks like it could be in a design magazine. Breakfast was provided in the morning, and was pretty good, coffee/tee machine, cereal, meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, croissants. Overall more than you would expect from a continental breakfast. Hotel location is pretty good, it is no more than a 15 minute walk to just about any tourist attraction you would want to go to. Staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations on where to go. The hotel was perfect and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: gojaincr
Reviews.Content: A friend, my partner and I were in Amsterdam for five nights. We booked both a single and a double-bedded room. My bias is to stay in small properties (less than 30 rooms) and Chic and Basic was more than a pleasant surprise. This is my third trip to Amsterdam and I have stayed in the Grand Tulip (200+) and in a canal house on previous trips. One of the gems of the hotel is its staff - more about that later. With the exception of housekeeping, everyone was fluent in English - my native language and some were fluent in spanish - the native language of my partner and my friend. Housekeeping had a perfectly good understanding of english - significantly better than my non-existent dutch! First the location. C&B is conveniently positioned facing the second canal - Herengracht - within a short walk to Cental Station and the major tram/bus routes in the city. The character of the neighborhood in which C&B is located is very quiet residential yet within two blocks are an excellent restaurant (just across the pedestrian bridge on Broeweurgraht (sp)) and a neighborhood coffee shop. Two more blocks and there is a secondary shopping area with an abundance of restaurants/retail locations (but not the cookie cutter stores seen in most major cities that cater primarily to tourists). And the location of the hotel is within a ten to twenty minute walk to any of the active night life, restuarants, museums and typical shopping fare. As indicated in other posts, the rooms are smallish. If you plan on staying in your room most of your stay in Amsterdam, then this is not the property for you. Neither of the two rooms we booked had an area separate from the bed for writing or reading - less of a problem when traveling alone but problematic if traveling with another person and on different sleep schedules. The ability to read in bed is futher limited by an absence of reading lights - the room is either fully lit or dark with no in between possibilities. A common area is available for guests to take advantage of flat writing spaces as well as providing complimentary wifi if you have your own computer. Adjacent to the common area is a computer with high-speed and complimentary internet connectivity. The rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean - kudos to the housekeeping team. And each of our rooms had excellent hot water heat, plenty of water pressure and large windows that opened easily. The windows included both sheer curtains for filtered light and a curtain to darken the room considerably when sleeping during the occassional afternoon nap. The only "weathered" look in the hotel was the carpet leading to the rooms. It appears the carpet has remnants of last winter's snow and boot traffic. The carpet appears to be in good shape but not as clean as it could be and certainly not as spotless as are the rooms. And while speaking of stairs - they are typically Amsterdam - a cross between stairs and a vertical ladder. The self-serve breakfast offers an ample selection of fresh fruits, cheese, juices, hard boiled eggs, cold cuts, etc. The bread an role variety was exceptional and an apple tart can only be described as "european" - excellent flavor, texture and not ruined with sugary sweetness. But for the three of us, the most important element of our stay was the staff in the hotel. They were extraordinarily helpful and friendly - it was as if we were staying with friends and not interacting with the typical stadoffish clerks in larger hotels. Indeed, one evening we were invited to go "local" with a member of the staff. We in turn have invited their staff to visit with us whenever they come to Costa Rica. If going to Amsterdam again, this would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for 2 nights and just loved the hotel. The staff could not be faulted, they were friendly and helpful with every request. The location was great too, just a short walk from Central station in a very nice part of Amsterdam towards the Jordaan area. We had a Calal view room on the first floor and it was just what we expected from a Amsterdam hotel. It wasn't too small, and had enough room for our luggage and still be able to move around! I would definitely stay here again when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased....”
Reviews.Author: Chippy78
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I booked Hotel New Amsterdam online a couple months before our planned stay of August 26-29, 2007. When we arrived on what we thought was the street where our hotel was located after approx. a 10 min. walk from the train station, we walked by Chic and Basic, wondering if that was our hotel. Well luckily one of the employees saw us walking back & forth looking confused & came out to see if we were looking for Hotel New Amsterdam. He then told us it had changed ownership & had a new name. At first walking in there I was slightly disappointed, I had loved how quaint & unique it had looked before when we reserved it. We had the mini-suite on the top floor and I must say in the end I was not disappointed. The rooms had all been re-done. Our room was very clean, smelled of fresh paint, sparseley finished but had everything we needed. The bed was sooo comfortable. The stairs as you keep reading in these reviews were a killer! We had 3 very steep flights to our door, then once we unlocked our door had another flight actually into our room. Climbing them was almost like climbing a ladder!! The view out our window was fantastic. Breakfast was simple but sufficient & the staff was happy to hold our bags on the day we checked out as our flight did not leave till 10pm that nite. The location was perfect, close to everything but far enough away to be nice & quiet in a nice residential neighborhood. So although this was not the hotel we expected when arriving in Amsterdam, it did not disappoint at all. The only thing I can say I did not like was the tacky red lips shaped seat outside in front of hotel. I avoided having that in my pictures b/c it looked so cheap. But that really didn't deter from the wonderful time had here. Would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Freddy532
Reviews.Content: Chic and Basic was very charming, in an excellent location and on a quiet beautiful road, with a B&B feel but with the amenities of a boutique hotel (relaxing lounge music, Wi Fi, great cappucino machine, etc.), and above all, fantastic service by their reception / managers. Knowledgeable and attentive professionals like Ferdy make Chic and Basic a great option for different categories travelers to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: burroontour
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam after a 4 night stay, staying with friends for 3 nights at The Flying Pig Hostel Downtown and then staying for one night with my boyfriend at Chic and Basic for a little bit of a treat before heading home. Chic and Basic is probably a good way of summing up the experience. The only information we were given on check in was the time of breakfast and that we could use the internet for free. I'd read about the free coffee machine but was not introduced, I'm also not sure what happens if you want an alcoholic drink (though I saw some spirits at breakfast behind the counter!). There was also a sauna but again no idea if you were allowed to use it or how you would go about it! Saying that the hotel is modern and clean, room fine (proper double bed, not 2 singles as is often the way). We were in room 111 on the first floor, canal view, stairs ok, I've seen much steeper!. Small room, small bathroom but good shower. Tea and coffee facilities and TV. Main positive was the breakfast which is the best I have had in Amsterdam. Having stayed at about 5 hotels in Amsterdam I would say this has many positives going for it for a small hotel in a traditional Amsterdam building. Good location near central station but near enough away from the Red Light district for my liking. Good bars and restaurants nearby. On a quiet canal which is lovely for walking along, very romantic! A good value hotel, I'd be interested in staying in a larger room though if I returned, especially if for more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Chic....and basic it is.”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1945
Reviews.Content: Basic it is. No elevator, no reading lights, no closets, no shower curtin, limited tv channels, steep stairs (not recommended for people with disabilities. And, not sure you could put two people in a room comfortably. That said. Great location & staff. Good competitive rate. Decent breakfast. Internet terminal for guests and all the coffee you want. Recommend highly if you are an independent traveler looking for a great Amsterdam experience!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisChicago38
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and stylish. Very gay friendly and close to everything...bars, shopping, canal cruises, Red Light District. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenience, helpful staff - what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: If you're after a unique hotel which differs from the mainstream then book this place! Our room was everything we hoped for - it was on the top floor overlooking a canal and encompassed really smart design. The welcome bag was a great touch - great tolitetries! The breakfast was brilliant and included in the price - lots of choice. The free internet access was a welcome bonus as well. The location is really handy - it's in Jordaan, a really cool part of Amsterdam which was close to the centre but not in the middle of it, and was about a 5-10 minute walk from the train station. One word of caution - the stairs to our room were really narrow (not unusual for Amsterdam) and it was hard to carry heavy suitcases up the stairs. The staff were more than happy to help out but ask for a room on a lower floor if you're mobility-impaired.

Reviews.Title: “Treated great at Chic and Basic.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily003
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel when it was called Hotel New Amsterdam. When we arrived it was called Chic and Basic. My husband and I and our two daughters had to have two rooms to accommodate us. The rooms were pretty small, as were the bathrooms. Both rooms were up quite a few stairs. The views out the rooms were of the canal, so that was very nice. The location was great, especially with it's easy walk to the train station. The staff in the hotel was absolutely wonderful to us, especially when they carried out suitcases all the way up the stairs. Great espresso machine. Overall, just really nice experience, mostly because of the great staff. We did not like Amsterdam very much, but we liked Chic and Basic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KBrooner
Reviews.Content: We were so happy we chose Hotel New Amsterdam (now Chic + Basic) for our 3 night stay in Amsterdam. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Central Station and is located canal side on one of the most beautiful canals. We decided to pay a little extra for the canal view room and it was worth it!!! We left our windows open the whole time and enjoyed the sounds of Amsterdam. Our double room was great, a little small, but enough room for everything. The bathroom was clean and nice too! The stairs are a climb, but part of the fun. Every morning we ate breakfast at the hotel (included) it was really nice. Bread, rolls, cereal, fruit, cheese, meat, yogurt, juice, coffee and water. We loved the 24-7 coffee machine to make espresso or cappucinos, the water jug and computer to use. The staff was very helpful with all of our questions. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved this newly named hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaTravellover
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights in the Hotel New Amsterdam and arrived to find it has a new name - Chic and Basic - part of a small European hotel chain. The lounge/breakfast room was very chic and modern with real espresso and lattes available to guests any time of day. The staff was immensely helpful and friendly and the breakfasts fresh and tasty. We had a lovely large room overlooking the canal with a good sized ensuite bathroom and comfy beds. The only disadvantage of this lovely hotel is that there is no elevator and 36 steep steps to our room. However, the desk clerks carried our luggage up and down and housed it in a secure room on our last day as we went sightseeing before our flight left for Canada. One of the desk clerks invited us for a private tour of the canals on his motor boat. We settled on 60 Euros for an hours trip but we had such a wonderful time travelling around the city and getting to know our guide while enjoying the wine and picnic dinner he brought along that the journey ended up being three hours. We suggested to him that he could offer tours to other tourists - we were his first clients. Don't let the many stairs deter you from staying at Chic and Basic. It's a super hotel on a very quiet canal just a 5 minute walk from the Central Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels, hope that doesn't change...”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: This has been one of those "finds". I have stayed here about four times in the last two years and I have always enjoyed my stay. While the rooms are on the small side (even by European standards), they are comfortable. The location cannot be beat -- sitting at the intersection of the Herengracht and Brouwersgracht it is one of the prettiest parts of the canal rings. And it is literally less than 10 minutes walk to the Central Station. But on my last visit I see that the hotel management has changed hands and it is now part of a Spanish chain called "Chic + Basic". The hotel was in a flux period as they are renovating some of the rooms, but the staff remains the same and they are very good and friendly! Let me tell you my what I see as the potential upside/downside of this management change. First the style is changing from quaint contemporary Dutch to modern and austere. Immediate upsides -- they seem to be renovating many of the rooms and while they were OK they are starting to show their age; free computer access in the lobby with wifi in the rooms. My concern is that you will see the prices start to rise, but some small increase might be expected. Finally, the continued saving grace is the location and the staff. The staff remain the hotel's single most valuable asset. I hope that doesn't change.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel New Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TX_Longhorn99
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I selected this hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews and were definitely not disappointed! It is in a very central area of town within walking distance of everything (some are longer walks than others!) - Niewmarkt, Red Light District, shopping areas, Van Gough Museum, Ryksmuseum, a couple of blocks away from the Anne Frank House, and close to many coffee shops and restaurants. Better yet, we took the train in from Schipol to Centraal Station (about 4 Euros), and the hotel was about a 10 minute walk from Centraal (handy b/c we had to lug a ton of luggage). The staff was super friendly and very helpful. As other people mentioned, they will hold your luggage for you in a locked room if you arrive early. We stayed in room 121 (a canalside double, on the 3rd floor, I think), which we had to walk up some narrow & steep flights of stairs. This was not a problem, as the staff carried our luggage up the stairs for us. The room was very nice and clean and was an excellent value for Amsterdam. As in most of Europe, there is no central air conditioning, but the temperature was very mild during our stay and did not cause any problems. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, but be sure to bring your own soap & shampoo (they provide shower gel). There is free coffee 24 hrs a day (from a fancy coffee machine), free high-speed internet access in the lobby, and complimentary breakfast, which consisted of pastries, toast, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, several types of juice, milk, and coffee. Very tasty! We had a very nice experience here, and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jakedoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed post cruise and enjoyed our stay. We arrived at approximately 10 AM and staff stored our luggage until our room was ready. Short 10 minute walk from Centrael station and located on a canal. Centrally located for a lot of sites. We were given an option for a smaller room with quite a large discount and took it. Small room on third floor, but good beds and we used room for just sleeping anyway. Staff carried luggage up for us. Had good nite sleep. Good Breakfast. While walking to Centrael station after check-out, a staff member getting off work offered to help with our luggage to the station since he was going that way. Nice gesture. Would definitely stay there again. Only problem I can forsee is someone with disabilities with the small stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but small things to work on.....”
Reviews.Author: Blueram
Reviews.Content: Nice tidy hotel, great location, breakfast, coffee machine and friendly staff. The only conâ€™s were room was small and walls are thin. The room (photos in the below reports with the monkeyâ€™s on the wall) we had included a large sky light window which allowed all the other guests in the higher floors a direct view of or room and partially of the bed. Even though there was a curtain that we could use to shield the bed you would have thought that management would at least frost the window and still have the benefits of the additional light from the skylight. I guess that is Amsterdam for you â€“ there is a view in every window ï�Š ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Great restaurant suggestions. Carried luggage to and from room because of steep narrow stairs. Looked up helpful information on computer. Very knowledgeable about their city. Comfortable room overlooking a canal. SMALL bathroom. Good breakfast including hard boiled eggs, fruit ,cereal, meats and cheeses, rolls, and fresh sqeezed orange juice. On a quiet street, which is only a ten minute walk from the central train station . Starting the week of Feb. 19th, and continuing for about 6 weeks, they will undergoing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: neuronx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early May and had an incredible time. The staff are extremely nice, and are always trying to please! The breakfasts were way above average (best we had in our whole Europe trip) and the rooms are lovely. We had a room with balcony on the 3rd or 4th floor which was superb. Great place to eat strawberries and cream! And the free drinks all day long.... yumm....

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RickSEuroTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this boutique"ish" hotel. We travelled for 5 weeks after leaving this hotel and this hotel remained in our thoughts throughout the whole trip. I loved the all you could drink espresso drinks in the lobby and the fresh circulated water. The hotel staff are SUPER friendly. We stayed in the "parrot room" - which happens to be the biggest room. This room had a lovely patio for us take in the fresh air. The bathroom is very small, but we dont spend a lot of time in there anyway! The bed was comfortable! Thank you New Amsterdam for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location but aimed at gay community.”
Reviews.Author: dingoQueensland
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable but small. We believe they cater for a gay market, whilst this does not bother us at all, we did find the explicit gay pornography left in the common areas offensive and gave the hotel a seedy element. We would feel the same way about heterosexual material being availabe in the same way. Would not stay there again based on this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malts
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel very wet as it was peeing down and did for most of our vacation but that didnt put us off!! We arrived very early at the hotel as our flight landed at 8.30am and they couldnt do enough to accommodate us with warm drinks and a comfy seat! Our rooms were almost ready so we hung around and were unpacked and back out to hit Amsterdam by 11am! The rooms are small but adequate and our friends managed to get the attic suite with a bedroom and seating area. The stairs are very steep and narrow and by the end of 4 days our legs were aching but you have to do it!!! There are no lifts in these old buildings. We didnt find noise an issue from our 3rd floor room - the only noise we could hear was the rain! The breakfasts were good. Freshly squeezed orange juice, cereals, eggs, cheese, ham, fruit and various freshly baked breads and rolls. The coffee is also really good and service very attentive. In fact all the staff are excellent and so friendly. Nothing was a problem and they went out of their way to speak to you on your way in and out of the hotel. The location of the hotel is also very good. About 5 minutes to Dam Square and the train station and 20 mins to the Southern Belt. We found the whole experience really good and would return to the hotel and recommend to others. Another good point, they have loads of umberellas which were needed during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “New Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MET-BAR-MUSO
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the New Amsterdam Hotel. It was our second stay there in 18 months. Superb very helpful staff. Nice modern, recently refurbished hotel. Excellent breakfast, excellent coffee, and the room was perfect. We have stayed in many hotels over the years and this ranked among the highest quality we have experienced. The room faced the canal and was a good size with a good sized bathroom. It was all nicely modern with an oldie worldie feel. We have stayed in room 321 both times and I understand that there are some sub-standard rooms in the hotel so if its free 321 should be your first choice. The Location is perfect too, nice quiet canal walks and, within 2 minutes there is a fine "coffee shop" and a further 2 minutes, all the shops. Harlemer street is very close by too with lots of nick-knack shops and supermarkets and excellent restaurants. Hotels in the dam can be a bit hit and miss but room 321 in the Hotel New Amsterdam is a hit every time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: chihuahua_star
Reviews.Content: I don't see how anyone could have any complaints about this fabulous hotel! Sure, the rooms are small, but this is Europe, and we did pay only 100 euro/night! Good things: -SUPER nice staff. Always helped with every need, even carried my very heavy suitcase up the narrow stairs for me =) -GREAT breakfast. Fresh squeezed juice, eggs, meats, cheeses, ect. -Free coffee anytime, from an awesome machine that could make anything from a macchiato to espresso. -Extremely clean rooms and bathroom. -Terrace to go out and sit at night with a glass of wine or a coffee. -Perfect location. Quiet residental street, but only a 1-5 minute walk to the more bustling areas. I could go on and on about this hotel. I have traveled through Europe since I was quite small, and this is the 1st hotel that I know for a fact that I will return to. I will never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. Some tips: -Eat at the resteraunt right accross the little pedestrian bridge by the hotel. It is fantastic, quiet, and reasonably priced with great food. -Visit Albert Hejin supermarket, they have great little snacks. -Anne Frank house and Van Gogh museum are must-sees. This hotel is only 2 streets over from the Anne Franks house (and visit on a weekday - we had no wait!). We had a great time and can't wait to go back. We loved this hotel so much that we are sending them a Christmas card. Please stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great canal view”
Reviews.Author: CR5
Reviews.Content: Booked for a canal view back in July but given some reviews were a little apprehensive that we would get one. Did we? Oh yes. We had the top floor in the attic area like a suite. Odd layout with separate toilet in one room and shower in another room. But 2 TV's (where else do you get 2- one for each room?) although not many channels Doors opened to reveal a view of the canal. Superb view and location and tea/coffee maker. Chuck in the tea and coffee on tap downstairs and its was a great hotel. Breakfast was OK although very basic. OK, some of the fixtures and fittings are a little dated but the quirkiness is its charm and to be honest I have been on six trips this year and I felt at home here. Try and get the canal view and if you can get the top floor suite (cost me Â£250Euros for 2 nights) then it is well worth it. Location is superb, less than the 10 mins walk from station as it says on website. More like 5/6 mins. Easy walk to the red light district and main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Woozles
Reviews.Content: Hotel New Amsterdam is a decent place to stay. It has a really nice location, right on a canal and is near to most activities. Good restaurants and coffee shops near by. The rooms are small but clean. I actually enjoyed the narrow staircases and the opportunity to see and live inside one of the beautiful historic buildings in Amsterdam. I will say that the bathroom is interesting with one room for the shower and sink and a separate, very small room for the toilet. We booked through the tourist office. (3 euro pp to book) and the rate was 100 euro a night. It did include breakfast but it was nothing impressive. All in all I enjoyed the hotel, the staff was friendly and the location was good. I would recommend them for a stay but would be a better deal at 70 to 80 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jrmintz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August and have lovely memories. The room was comfortable, modern, clean and quiet. The staff was very friendly, helpful and made me totally feel at home as a solo female traveller. It was a delight to see a smiling face at breakfast and when coming to and from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ly_ly38
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose the Hotel New Amsterdam after extensive online research, and after cancelling a reservation at another hotel after reading too many negative reviews. We loved the Hotel New Amsterdam! The location was excellent - centrally located between the Center and the Jordaan neighborhoods and we walked all over the city from there. Despite the location, the neighborhood itself was very quiet, which was something we'd really wanted. The staff was excellent. Everyone was extremely helpful and very friendly, and they really helped to make our stay absolutely perfect. When we arrived at the hotel after a sleepless night of traveling, they carried our suitcases up to our room for us after bringing us each the coffee of our choice. I'd also emailed them several days before to let them know we'd be arriving early and to ask if it would be possible to check in straight away, and they made sure that we were able to do so. The hotel was clean and quiet, and the room was perfect (though admittedly, the shower pressure wasn't great). The guys always had excellent touring and restaurant suggestions as well, and really seemed to enjoy interacting with the guests. I can't emphasize how wonderful this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “appreciated the extra help in our time of need”
Reviews.Author: mahatma
Reviews.Content: i have been to amsterdam twice previously and know my way around the city center. i was taken to the hotel by my partner for my birthday. we arrived at a lovely old canal house in an area of old houses, some made into hotels, some as professional business locations. it is a 5 minute walk from the central station. i would recommend a location a little closer to the museum areas so that you don't have to use the trams as much. this hotel has a nice continental breakfast with a machine that dispenses fresh orange juice. another machine makes espresso/cappucino by pressing buttons. most excellent as it is available 24 hours. the first room we had was up 2 flights with narrow steep stairs. not for the vertically challenged. the room was small but very comfortable. two twin beds put together created a lot of bed space that was appreciated. excellent shower. on our second day in amsterdam i was accidentally tripped and tore a calf muscle. the hospital put it is a cast and i was to be immobile for the next week. we only had two days remaining in amsterdam. the staff moved us to the ground floor and took every effort to make the remaining portion of our stay as comfortable as possible, including helping me go up and down the few steps to our room. all members of the staff receive the highest marks. they went so far as to allow us to stay in the second room for a longer period of time (as our trip was to extend following the time in holland) if we could not arrrange an earlier flight. when we arranged the earlier flight they released us from any further room obligation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel-great service”
Reviews.Author: rickythegoat
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 2 night stay at the Hotel New Amsterdam with my wife and 11 year old son and have to say what a joy it was,from the initial welcoming cup of tea to the final goodbye it was a superb experience. The hotel is very centrally located just a 10 minute walk from the Central Station and next to a charming canal and although the rooms are on the small side(we had the mini-suite in the loft which had a tricky low ceiling! and generally traditional Amsterdam hotels are on the small side) they are beautifully decorated and very cosy with high quality furnishings.Just look out for the steep stairs if you have large suitcases it can be hard work! The breakfast was typically continental with cold meats,cereals and a lovely selection of bread ,fresh juice and good coffee etc.served in a smart little dining room with a tv showing BBC news. What set this place apart for me was the service from all the staff who went out of their way to help and make us feel special-we have used many hotels in the US and Europe and can honestly say this hotel is right at the top when it comes to service,nothing was too much trouble. Would not hesitate in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: cruisesetc1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It's kind of funky because it's a couple of canal houses put together but the staff couldn't have been nicer. We went with my two kids and their friends so we had 3 rooms. My husband and I had the canal view which I loved and the kids had interior views that were basic walls. These all would have been great in normal circumstances but we were there in a heat wave so got a little toasty in the rooms but not their fault. A couple of fans might have helped but no one was prepared for the 96 degree weather. The location was fantastic, you could walk to the train station and all the main spots and you could catch the canal boats at the train station and get a day pass which gets you all over by boat. We had a car so they have a lot you can park at for a fee of I think about 20.00 per day. I would gladly recommend this hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience here”
Reviews.Author: sangio2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Amsterdam for 4 nights this past April. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was quite good. Absolutely great location at the corner of the Herengracht and Brouwersgracht canals. Easy walking distance to everything, but very quiet. We had the room on the first floor (second floor to the North Americans) facing the canal. It has a fantastic view, but we couldn't enjoy it much because the room is too small to sit and lounge. It's barely larger than the bed. But, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. And we spent most of our time away from the hotel in any event. We would stay there again, but I think I'd ask for a larger room.
